Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: GBoots
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for part of a girls weekend to Napa. The hotel is brand new and everything is fresh and clean. The room was fully equipped and even had complimentary detergent for the washer. The staff was extremely helpful with suggestions and answering questions. The shuttle is fantastic and the driver even stopped at Target for us on the way home from Downtown Napa! We loved getting the complimentary coffee from the lobby and drinking it in the vineyard. We loved this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: radman143
Reviews.Content: This is a newer timeshare/hotel that my wife and I just stayed at for a week. The resort is beautiful and many wonderful amenities like onsite restaurant, bar, concierge, workout center, walking trails, hot tubs and swimming pools. There is also a winery onsite which is very convenient. I would suggest talking to the concierge when first checking in as they were very helpful with activities and suggestions plus there is a shuttle that will take you downtown from 4:00pm that leaves every 45 minutes. We utilized this shuttle 3 different nights and was extremely happy to just call the driver and they would pick us up any time before 10:30 pm. Outstanding resort and would recommend for anyone going to stay in Napa even if it is just for 1 or 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Strange Location”
Reviews.Author: IMForever28
Reviews.Content: We booked a king suite at the Vino Bello Resort through a Travel Zoo special. The room itself was wonderful! There was a nice sitting area, kitchen, balcony, and even a washer and dryer (although difficult to use). The design of the hallway entrances to the rooms is odd. There is one door in the hallway which leads to a foyer area shared by two rooms. I think this helps to cut down on hallway noise, however when there is a shared area like that and the people in the other room are loud, it is amplified within that space. There is a huge parking problem at this resort and with the new expansion it will become even more troublesome. The parking lot is small and when it's full, people park along the street. It is a major inconvenience to park in the street and have a long walk back to your room, especially if you have luggage. At least they do not charge for parking. The resort is located in an industrial park. It's definitely not the location I expected based on the resort website. However once you are there, the beauty of the place takes over and you forget about the strange location. This is a time share resort and they will try to entice you to listen to their talk. I received a phone call before leaving on our trip to try and get me to sign up for their talk and was approached again at the concierge desk. I politely answered that I wasn't interested and they respected that each time. I did not feel pressured. We did not utilize the pool/hot tub area due to outdoor temperatures in the 50's. We ate at the lobby bar one night as well as the Siena restaurant on location. Please see separate review for this. Overall, we would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with a beautiful view!”
Reviews.Author: jwilson1897
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful spot. It was a real treat to have a full kitchen and a fantastic king sized bed. We walked around the property including the vineyard out behind the hotel. The only downer of the whole trip was the extra pull out couch my sister slept on was NOT comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “It seems strange when I'm supposed to be an owner...”
Reviews.Author: MrLauren
Reviews.Content: We arrived to see lot's of renovations being done (new automatic doors for the main hotel) I talked to the desk clerk at check in, she mentioned that there was a complementary bottle of wine, I'm not a drinker so I asked if maybe they had something non-alcholic instead, she said she would have some one get that to our room and exchange it. I had read about the aminities on the Shell Vacations web site and asked about the "heated pools" she said all the pools are heated to 80 degrees. I had told our children that we could go swim after we got settled in our room. They also have a complimentry movies you can pick up at the front desk. We checked in to a lovely room. At first glance the suite looked like it was in great shape. THE BAD...After further review it had some issues... 1) The phone system wasn't working at all. 2) Little things broken here and there. 3) The drier was very difficult to figure out and work with. It only had delecate cycle working so it took 3 hours for our clothes to dry. 4) THE POOL Heated to a BRISK 55 degrees...needless to say we did not swim in the pool. 5) Only one dvd player... At least the kids could watch a movie before bed time. 6) Little or nothing to do for the kids. THE GOOD 1) They let us have 2 movies instead of just the one we were supposed to have. 2) The hot tube was acutally hot and not 55 degrees also. 3) The rooms are visually beautiful we loved that they had a full kitchen and the decore was great. After all was said and done we had had enough and came home a night early.

Reviews.Title: “So far, so very good!”
Reviews.Author: betterlatethannever
Reviews.Content: We were here the last week of February. Weather was cold, crisp, raining on and off. Parking on the property is limited, but ample street parking near by. You are indeed, far from the maddening crowds of Napa, but thus, we enjoyed the peacefulness of the setting. We had a two bedroom suite in the Merlot building. We enjoyed the daily housekeeping features, heavy sturdy furniture, click on fireplace, our third floor balcony view of the sunsets, and convenient location. It was fun figuring out the deluxe shower w/ the overhead rain forest shower head and the 4 wall jets that make you feel like you're in a human car wash. Another night we relaxed in the in room jacuzzi. We've been to Napa many times, stayed in hotels, bed and breakfast establishments etc. and this was head and shoulders our best stay. (the other timeshares available in Napa pale in comparison). We even sampled some of the wine at the bar of the Meritage Resort and fell in love w// their Old Vine Shiraz. Too bad no gift store to purchase a bottle and the caves were closed for wine tastings by the time we returned from our day trips and not open before we checked out. We visited during the off season, although fully booked, the place did not seem to be over-run with guests. It was nice to have a simple breakfast in the room every morning. Watched movies (DVD's) at night and just relax. The internet was a bit spotty, at times not available at all, but that was just on one day of the six we were there. The concierge gave us some great reccommendations for dining. Gillwoods Cafe, for breakfast. Can't go wrong w/ Celedon, Brix, Mustard Grill, Angele's, and RIstorante Allegria. Disappointed with Rutherford Grill. Not sure at all, why this is rated so highly. The restaurant on site, The Siena was very good. (see other review). surprisingly good pizza. We used our stay here as a base for travel to Sonoma Valley, Calistoga, Silverado Trail etc. Life is short, Come to Vino Bello and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Napa tour base - Vino Bella”
Reviews.Author: canver5
Reviews.Content: While some construction on the far end of the property prevented easy lobby access this was no problem to getting in to register. While access is supposed to be 4pm,we did not get our room until after 5. The reason, though, was we requested a second floor vineyard view which is worth the wait. We were in the Chardonnay building in an end unit which was very desirable for view, quiet and brightness (room 2322). We used our Shell Vacation points and must say this is one of the most attractive Shell properties as far as room layout and decorating. There were several maintenance issues that were annoying (dishwasher did not work properly and it took 3-4 visits from staff), light bulbs burned out, hairdryer kicked out. In all cases response was quick. These things come up and I think many people just don't bother to call and have them corrected, so we seem to have issues wherever we go. One of the best features is the readily available shuttle for pick up and delivery to town, so eating out was a breeze. When we had friends visit, we had to go down to the main door to meet them as they could not even enter the building to knock on our door. Minor inconvenience for something that is probably a great safety feature. You are super secure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place run poorly”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot so my expectations are realistic. I normally donâ€™t have problems. I was very disappointed with the management of this place. Our rate varied from $200 on Sunday night to $300 on Friday and Saturday night. Not bad in season in Napa. Unfortunately you are in industrial park a ways from Napa. The A/C is extremely loud. This I could live with. My true problem is the management philosophy. The first morning we had no hot water. I called the front desk to let them know. They told me I was not the only one and they could not insure me it would be fixed. Second morning no hot water, called the desk they told me I was not only one and may not be fixed by the next morning. They said they would get some information and me call right back. I waited around, never received a call back. On the way out I bumped into a guy in the elevator who told me he had changed rooms because he had no hot water. That evening when we returned to the hotel I called and spoke to manager and explained everything. He tried to convince me this was the first they new of the problem, and that I was the only one with an issue and he would get it fixed. All hotels log complaints, he new much better then I did they have a problem with their hot water system. They sent a guy up, who was very nice and realized this was just game. They finally admitted they could not fix it. The manager never admitted they have problems with their hot water system that appears to be ongoing. They finally moved us to a room with hot water. When I say my problem is with the management, when you travel you will have a problem from time to time that is unavoidable. Your problem may be something other then hot water but how the management responds to the problem will be consistent. The fact that they feel its fine to charge me $300 a night for a room with no (not a little not warm) hot water is criminal. There are industry standards for items like this. They failed to make any effort to mitigate our inconvenience. I guess I could have went there and begged for some money off, but if that what it takes they can keep it. I should have had the credit card company stop payment but we booked through Orbits so that would be a pain. So I ask if you go there and have problems with your hot water please write a review.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facilities, poor front desk customer service”
Reviews.Author: Sixfeetsmall7757
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting Napa for a quick trip. Our jaws hit the floor with the value and beauty of the hotel. Amenities are wonderful and we were thankful to catch up on laundry in room. However, we were disappointed by time wasted with staff error. We were assigned to the wrong room... Unlocked the door to be enamoured by the beauty... And devastated we were in someone else's room. 30 mons later someone brought up new room keys. Air conditioning broke, waited another 30 mins to be fixed. Still waiting on billing errors to be corrected because they couldn't figure out how to bill our credit card beyond an eight dollar charge. We loved the facilities, but wish we could've spent less time "fixing" things that should be caught and corrected by staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea K
Reviews.Content: Lovely facility! Very peaceful setting and an excellent location. Our room was very spacious and felt as if we were in a nicely sized 1 bedroom condo with a full kitchen with granite counters. Housekeeping was very prompt and thorough. The spa was fabulous! I could have stayed there all day. It was my first visit to the Napa Valley and I hope to return someday. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Shannon J.”
Reviews.Author: Shannon J
Reviews.Content: Beautiful facility - clean, nicely maintained. The spa facilities were some of the best I've experienced. Excellent location - wine country / restaurants, everything one could want is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah K
Reviews.Content: This property was fantastic, very quiet and relaxing. We stayed in a king room which was essentially a deluxe one bedroom apartment with granite counter tops and stainless appliances. They have a great restaurant, FABULOUS spa and tasting room on site. I have stayed there twice already and will absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: jt4404
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to the Napa Valley for a week for a wine tasting vacation and opted for this facility. The rooms are large, modern, clean and fairly quiet, with a comforable bed, fully equipped kitchen, and huge bathroom. Service was excellent. We didn't visit the common areas, so can't comment on them. Even though it's on the south end of the valley, it was convenient enough to get to any winery in the area, as well as all of the great restaurants. We would highly recommend a stay at the Vino Bello, especially if you're staying for more than a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: allenpooh
Reviews.Content: We booked this place blind for the first day of our weekend getaway to Napa. We paid about $100 for a studio, but upon arival were offered a 1 bedroom for an additional $30. The room was beautiful with a full kitchen and spa tub in the seperate bedroom. The staff was extremely attentive and the resort offers a shuttle to downtown if you want to eat or explore off property. I cooked dinner in the room and we ordered room service for breakfast, which was terific. The property is located on the south end of Napa Valley, and not in the mmost beautiful place, but the property itself is landscaped very nicely. It's about 8 minutes to our favorite winery (VanDerHyden...go there!) and the Stags Leap side of the valley. Tip, the quality of the wine is inversly proportional the size of the tasting room. Fancy building = crappy wine. Try to find the old experienced wineries, not the 400 or so that have opened in the last 15 years.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Delicious”
Reviews.Author: Graceramirez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are owers of Shell Vacations Club, this is one of thier beautiful locations. We alway enjoy our time there even if the weather is overcast, we just get a Limosine to drive us to private vineyards and enjoy several bottles of wine with our family and our friends who we invite to share this experience with us. The Resort has a beautiful rooms overlooking a wine cave and our rooms have plenty of room to entertain with a fireplace to keep us warm. This is were we would love to live when we retire.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Resort”
Reviews.Author: NapaDiamond
Reviews.Content: As an owner of Shell Vacation Club, this is one of their properties. This was a "staycation" for us and we absolutely loved it. All the units have kitchens, which we really like as an amenity regardless of where we vacation. Raley's is just a few minutes drive North on Soscol, so you can pick up groceries there. The resort is not located in the heart of town, so if you are an urbanite, stay elsewhere. We like the location for the peace and quiet. The resort has a pathway through a vineyard to the Grape Press structure that you can see from highway 29. Cole's Chophouse is our favorite restaurant in Napa, try their Chocoloate Martini for dessert, yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Soooo nice!! Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Stacy E
Reviews.Content: I wish I lived there!! We like to travel on the cheap but wanted to upgrade to live it up a bit in Napa. Couldn't believe for how much we paid (like $230?) what we got! A whole apartment - we weren't expecting that! Balcony, luxury bathroom, full kitchen, and...hot tub in the bedroom!! What?!?! Splurge a little for a suite. Seriously the best hotel I've ever been in. We loved it. Very easy to drive from San Francisco to this hotel. The pool was really nice - we were the only ones in it towards the evening. And they have their own vineyard that you can walk around and explore - that was a really cool part too! Obviously, I highly recommend this place. As far as location goes - to tell you the truth it doesn't really matter in Napa Valley - you are going to drive from vineyard to vineyard all day long. It was nice to have our hotel a little off the track. It's easy to spend a lot of money on accomodations in wine country - so this was luxury but surprisingly affordable.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing, excellent location, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: travelerista
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Vino Bello for a business trip in early January 2012 and it couldn't have been better. The service was excellent, the location was very easy from the San Francisco airport, the main Napa highway with all the wine tastings, the Silverado Trail, and downtown Napa and Sonoma. The rooms were beautifully appointed and comfortable, the wine tasting in the cave was very cool, breakfast at the on-site restaurant was fabulous, and service was wonderful. The walking trail/vineyard up the hill was a happy surprise, and the jazzy guitar music piped out at the two pool areas and firepit made it very welcoming. Wish I had time to visit the spa. I would seriously consider purchasing a timeshare here.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort, terrible construction!”
Reviews.Author: missysmovin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom unit and were very impressed. Room was gorgeous with jacuzzi tub, fireplace, spacious bathroom, well stocked kitchen and nice bed linens (except too large pillows but fortunately I had brought my own). Loved taking walks in the vineyard, playing bocce ball and the wine tasting evening was very nice. We had room service and ate at the onsite restaurant and it was excellent. The staff was wonderful as well. Unfortunately I can't give it 5 stars for the following reasons: Wi-fi was very slow at times and didn't work in certain areas. They should suspend the mandatory $15/day fee until they get this worked out. But our big complaint was the noise!! It was a little riduculous. We could hear EVERYTHING our neighbors did - closing doors, closing drawers, every step they took, we could even hear what they were watching on TV. For 2 or 3 nights in a row we were kept awake from the night owls above us walking around etc. The worst was on the 4th night when they checked in a new family above us at 3:00am!! (not kidding). So again we were kept awake by the really loud noise of them settling in. We called the front desk and they apologized but nothing seemed to change as the noise continued till almost 5:00am. We were not happy!! The hotel is aware of their major noise issue so they should either not allow check-ins at that hour or be considerate to their presently booked guest and put the late check-ins on the ground floor or at least in a room that doesn't have guests right underneath who they know are TRYING TO SLEEP! As unhappy as we were wth that situation we will likely return if we can be guaranteed a third floor unit as we loved everything else about our stay. Or now we'll at least know to bring earplugs :)

Reviews.Title: “An Upscale Apartment”
Reviews.Author: DnA4Ever
Reviews.Content: The Vino Bello Resort was an exceptional experience. There are seperate buildings, much like a small, upscale apartment complex. Our one-bedroom suite was esconced in the Chardonnay building. It was luxuriously appointed in most everyway. The suites were clean, with obvious attention to detail. The suite design was warm and charming, yet with a new feel. We did, however, experience an unfortunate glitch our first night. We were visiting during a chilly night in October, so we turned on the heat. By the wee hours of the morning it was very clear the heat was not working. It proved to be a rather uncomfortable night of "half-sleep" as we opted not to have a repairman in our suite in the middle of the night. We contacted the front desk in the morning and the issue was addressed by the time we returned from some lovely local vineyards. I was a little surprised that we weren't offered some small perk or recompense for our trouble, however. All in all, I would give the Vino Bello a 4.5 out of 5 stars, if it were an option.

Reviews.Title: “Wine country for everyone”
Reviews.Author: aprilmike
Reviews.Content: The Vino Bello resort was very clean and comfortable. The restaurant was a good value for the gourmet meals offered. The concierge service was top notch and they went out of their way to make reservations for us. The resort was very central to anything we wanted to see. We were very satisfied with the Vino Bello for amenities, service and location. The only detraction was the high spa prices at the on site spa that was beautiful and luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of Napa”
Reviews.Author: mjlulu
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Vino Bello Resort while visiting the many wineries of Napa, and cannot say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay. We reserved a one bedroom unit, and the accomodations where outstanding. To say it was luxurious, would be an understatement. The staff were extremely courteous, knowledgable, and ready to give us advice on what do to while we were in Napa/Sonoma. We will definitely return to the resort on our next visit. Traveler tip: visit Napa in the off season, tasting rooms are not crowded, rates are lower, and selecting a restaurant is easy. Don't miss the Hess Art Gallery, Artesa Vineyard, or dinner at the Greystone Culinary Institute.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Option in Napa”
Reviews.Author: CMFM
Reviews.Content: We had business in the Napa area and came a day early for a little R & R. Got a great rate on Priceline for this property but I didn't know what to expect. The reviews sounded very positive though and they were right. This is a great spot; romantic and relaxing. The hotel is part of a time share and there appears to be a variety of room sizes - ours had small kitchen, couch, washer and dryer, large bathroom with soaking tub and comfortable bed. The pillows were NOT comfortable however - two were too large and two others were small and soft. That messed up sleep a bit. Room was quiet but that is probably because there were not many people staying in that section. I heard housekeeping staff in the room next door when we arrived and they were a bit loud. No problems though, quiet all night. We enjoyed a couples massage at the Terra Spa. Spa was spacious, well appointed, and so relaxing, we were the last clients of the day and it was perfect way to unwind. Had dinner in the restaurant - we shared lamb chops, short ribs and a lot more food than we should have - and it was all excellent. Cocktails and wine suggestions were also spot on. Better pillows, a nicer view and some attention to detail in the rooms (some dings in the paint in spots) would have moved this stay into the Excellent category. However, we will likely stay here again when we have the chance, because even though it is not IN the town of Napa ( it is actually located amongst groups of office complexes, the Vino Bello provides comfortable room options, a great spa, a wine tasting cave (closed by the time we got done with massages) and a terrific restaurant. All within very close drive to Napa, and Yountville.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Experience”
Reviews.Author: sam k
Reviews.Content: This place is so romantic and maintained exellently. They have a good sized jacuzzi tub next to master bed and a walk in shower. I had a great time in here with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NelCalifornai
Reviews.Content: We tried to book a bed and breakfast but they were all full. Vino Bello is a nice resort. The rooms are beautiful and you can walk in the vineyard. You need a car as the hotel isn't walking distance to anywhere. The pool area is very peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and new”
Reviews.Author: EuroShiro
Reviews.Content: This place was very clean and new. We were first placed in a building which was just being finished but were switched to a different room the next day, no hassle, no fuss. The gym isn't well equipped but the pool area is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: AARC
Reviews.Content: Vino Bello is a timeshare resort owned by Shell Vacations. We are an owner, but that could be weird for someone who isn't familiar with timeshare places. We enjoyed our stay. They gave us a free bottle of wine from the winery located on the property, which is technically called the Meritage. The best things about the Vino Bello is an on-site bar, on-site tastings, a jacuzzi, BBQs, a kiddie pool and water play area, vineyards on the property, a restaurant on the property, AND a spa. We like to go into towns and explore, but I could see how you literally could have everything you need there, especially if you've had enough tastings for the day and just need to chill out without driving. Also, if you're there with family/kids, it would make it really easy to sneak away and do the spa or a wine tasting without cutting out the kids for long. Just really convenient and a nice place. Also, even the studios have a kitchenette with microwave, sink, and whatever you need. No stove in the studios, but there is a toaster oven that you can use to cook some things in. Also, the bathtub was large and could actually fit those that don't usually fit! Not too far from downtown Napa. Not right in the heart of the wineries, but not a terrible location either. Hopefully you have a smartphone so you can find it at night, though. You'll go through a corporate park before finding it, and it would be easy to not find it or think you're in the wrong place.

Reviews.Title: “A classy place!”
Reviews.Author: Babysis727
Reviews.Content: The condo was beautiful with quality furnishings! The property was beautiful with a nice view of the vineyards. The staff was very accomodating. The restaurant was delicious with good service (only ate there one time). There are just a few things which would make it better: 1.. closer in town for Napa, but it only takes a few minutes to get to downtown Napa or other towns in the Napa Valley. 2. better insulation between the rooms. noisy at times. 3. better quality mattress on sleeper sofa. I wish all condos (timeshares) were this nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “flawless”
Reviews.Author: shara m
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at Vino Bello and everything was perfect we stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment which was beautifully decorated new and clean. The bed was very comfortable, nice linens, plush towels, kitchen fully equipped. They do hit you with those extra charges but on the other hand they do not nickel and dime you. free wifi, free bussiness center with printer (if you do not have your own laptop)they start you with a bottle of wine, and everyday replenish the bottled water, coffee, laundry detergent and if you need more not a problem. They staff was wonderful, excellent restaurant, and very cozy bar. They are about 10 to 15 mins away from everything but they do offer shuttels going to downtown napa. We drove, no traffic, no problem. We had the best breakfast at a place in downtown napa called "butter cream bakery and diner" you really must go there. If you need anything from the front desk... Evan is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to launch your wine tours”
Reviews.Author: Challah
Reviews.Content: We found Vino Bello through our Shell Timeshare. The accommodations were roomy, clean and comfortable. We've been there in the fall and in the spring, separated by about a year and a half. The staff was gracious and helpful on both trips, but have to say we loved it a little more in the fall. What could beat having a message from the front desk telling you the merlot grapes were being harvested that day if we wanted to watch? And so we opened our curtains and there it was. Vino Bello also provides a shuttle bus into Napa to keep wine tasters safe. A nice feature. The location was off the highway and seemed to pop up from nowhere, but since our suite faced the vineyard and the giant sculpture of "The Crusher," we had no complaints with that. The kitchen was well appointed and everything worked. Outdoor grills were available to those who wanted to cook. The bathroom was luxurious, with a separate spa tub between the bedroom and the shower and toilet part of the bathroom. It was a nice extravagance. The outdoor pool provided a place to rest between wine tours and wonderful meals. The small balcony off the large living room was where we had our breakfasts and came back for the sunsets with a glass of wine. I have no idea what the cost is as a hotel rental, but as a timeshare, it was a steal.I have no doubt that we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay option in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: BradJill
Reviews.Content: We booked the one bedroom suite (w/ pullout sofa bed) at the Vino Bello Resort through booking.com for $349 and $299 (for Sat and Sun night). The resort charged additional fees of $15 per night (resort fee), $48 per night occupancy tourism tax. This made the price of our stay a bit high for a two-day stay but we were generally happy with our stay at the Vino Bello. We stayed in the Chardonnay building, which overlooked the pool and a hillside vineyard just beyond the pool. Our suite offered efficient central heating/air conditioning, a washer and dryer, full-equipped kitchen with complimentary coffee, bottled water and bottle of Muscato from the Trinitas winery. There was one spacious bathroom with an excellent shower with five separate heads (nice!). The living room furniture was very comfortable and the TV channel selection was standard and sufficient. The sofa pullout bed was not terribly comfortable, probably best for younger children, less suitable for older adults and not advisable for the elderly. The master bedroom included a very comfortable bed, and medium soft pillows that felt to be feathered. There was a television, plenty of space and a safe large enough to hold my laptop, large camera, extra digital camera and paperwork. There was also a patio that overlooked the pool and hillside that included four iron cushioned chairs as well as a two seat bench of similar make. This was nice for a morning coffee and afternoon wine after a day of wine touring in Napa. The Hotel restaurant called Siena Restaurant was also very good. We had two very nice breakfasts there twice and evening room service â€“ ordering two hamburgers and a cheese ($14.00), pepperoni and Italian sausage pizza ($13.50) and two chocolate deserts â€“ canâ€™t recall the price. Everything that came from Siena was very good to excellent, easily recommendable, making it a decent idea just to eat at the Vino Bello instead of going into Napa centre to find good food. Lastly, the service of the hotel was superb. We had a quick check-in and check-out experience and the concierge helped highlight the Napa region, suggest wineries based on our wine preferences and called in our afternoon tasting reservation to Del Dotto as well. Room service staff was very punctual and friendly. Overall, other than the less than comfortable sofa bed, I find few areas of improvement for the Vino Bello and offer high recommendation for choosing this resort as your base for exploring the Napa region.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID: Dated Overpriced Rooms + Additional $15/Day Resort Fee”
Reviews.Author: PD2K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend. I never heard of this hotel, but since all the major hotels in Napa were booked I decided to take a chance on it. I now regret my decision. I cannot fathom anyone who has stayed in a decent hotel giving Vino Bello a positive review. First of all, the hotel is way overpriced - charging $230/night. You'd get a better deal at the Marriott, Embassy Suites, or Hilton at a lower price. The $15/day resort fee is a TOTAL SCAM. This is in ADDITIONAL to the daily rate. The location is in a corporate park located far from the vineyards. The rooms are dated and damaged - dents in walls and doors. Breakfast is NOT included, unlike most other Napa hotels. The only reason I see staying here is if you are a time-share member. Otherwise avoid like the plague. There are far better and cheaper options available.

Reviews.Title: “Been here three times now and love it”
Reviews.Author: fromsocal
Reviews.Content: I dont want to repeat myself, but this place is so worth it. We had a nice one bedroom suite with full kitchen. The rooms are beautiful and are set up so nice, especially after a day of wine tasting. You can cook up your paste in the kitchen or maybe grill a steak on the provided bbq's next to pool. Open a bottle of wine and sit on your balcony or patio and enjoy! Some may say that they dont like the location, but we find it nice because it is next to the main roads that go west to Sonoma or North to Napa Valley. When you first drive up, you think you are headed into a business area, but once you are there you will love it. You can take a morning walk through the attached vineyards and it is peaceful. We did go on a weekend , so we did not experince any noise from the new expansion, but there is construction going on this year next to the sister resort. I doubt you would be disturbed on this side of property though.

Reviews.Title: “great value for time share owners”
Reviews.Author: nb29707
Reviews.Content: I had business at the Meritage next door, then used my time share for a 1 bedroom king unit. It was very spacious. The service was good, they cleaned the room ,made the bed ,changed the towels ,and supplied water and coffee etc. everyday, It is full kitchen with pots and pans and glasses etc. The grill by the pool is available to use and is cleaned everyday. The bed was comfortable and the bath was fantastic. The shower with 4 shower heads and the top one are great. You need a car to stay here. They have a shuttle but only for dinner in Napa. You can use the Meritage work out room and the spa is very nice. Free wifi and free local calls are nice for arranging wine tours etc. People complain about the location in a business park but the views out the back are of the vineyards and the pool. It is great. The restaurant is so-so. The breakfast buffet is ok but the best is the Meritage breakfast for $10, 2 eggs , bacon or sausage, potatoes, and sour dough bread.. Tea is $2.99 I think which I think should come with the breakfast. It's free in the lobby. If you have a time share check it out. I think the points required are very little compared with others I have used. I would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “location not too great but a beautiful place to stay at..”
Reviews.Author: WithLove71
Reviews.Content: we loved our stay here , enjoyed the pool and spa , the rooms were very beautiful, a little pricey for the location of the resort ...

Reviews.Title: “LOVE, LOVE!”
Reviews.Author: Schmitts
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful resort! We had a one bedroom (king sized bed) with connecting bedroom. (This makes their 2 bedroom) The decor is gorgeous. We walked in and my husband said it was the nicest hotel room he's ever stayed in. Granite counters AND dining room table, spacious kitchen, gorgeous travertine and glass shower, XL bathroom and jacuzzi tub. I can't say enough about how nice the rooms were. And we received a free bottle of wine as a 'Welcome Gift". Bed and pillows were comfortable. Even better we had first floor that walked out to the pool. We did not dine here or use the spa, but we did spend time in the pool area and we would go back just for that. Our 4 year old had a blast playing in the sprinkler area (water shooting up from the ground) and the kids pool. We used the grills in the pool area both days. The grocery store is only a couple miles away, as is Target in the event you forget something. The views from the hotel are non-exsistent but this place outshines its boring surroundings! We will be back just to stay at the hotel and enjoy it's amenities (in summer-time). I have no idea how much the rooms cost, we are Shell Vacation owners and it was worth all the points we used. I will say though that the resort is very classy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but location is commercial”
Reviews.Author: Corkette
Reviews.Content: Our friend has a timeshare so we stayed at two of the condo/rooms at Bello Vino. Bello Vino is next door to the Meritage and there is a considerable amount of construction going on next door. We didn't hear any noise and weren't affected by the construction but it was definitely visible. We enjoyed the rooms but the location of the resorts are in a commercial area. I went for 5 mile runs in the area and it was commercial office building after another with the exception of the golf course and a decent paved walking path a couple of miles away. The fitness room is the bare basics and on the depressing and claustrophic side. I walked in and walked right out. I don't think more than 3 people could comfortably work out in there at once and for a resort this size it is seriously lacking. Everyone working at the resorts was friendly and helpful. The staff at the Siena restaurant on site was friendly and extremely accomodating. They answered all of our questions and modified our breakfasts exactly as we requested. When we told them we were rushed to meet our driver they totally understood and rushed to get us our breakfasts and check right away. I would definitely recommend staying here if given the opportunity. My only regret is that I ran out of time to check out their wine and spa cave.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a resort, NOT a good location, TERRIBLE value, DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: seasand55
Reviews.Content: It's ridiculous that this place is called a resort. It's located in a business park, it's still under construction, it's not near any of the wineries, it has no view, it's terribly expensive for what's given, once there you can totally tell you're in a time share. The room itself was nice, big and comfortable with a kitchenette, but after visiting the wineries you don't want to have to drive far away to reach your room. We were there for our honeymoon and they gave us a complimentary bottle of wine, which was nice, but this is not what you expect from a so-called resort. They say they have a shuttle to downtown Napa (not any of the wineries) but it only seats 8 people, arrives every 20-30 minutes and only until midnight. It's a 7 minute drive to downtown Napa, makes no sense...We also had to complain twice about the concierge. Upon checking in he forgot to give us his packet so he decided to call at 8am the next morning! They knew we were here in our honeymoon and obviously on vacation...who calls that early in the morning?!? Then, he just shows up at our door and walks into our room?!? We scream, he leaves the "packet" and runs off. This important packet consisted of brochures and a wine bottle opener...ridiculous! We had already decided what wineries to visit and were not in need of this crappy brochure packet. Overall this place sucked and would not recommend it to anyone. We should have stayed at a b&b...since we had booked The Donatello in San Francisco and they are owned by the same parent company we thought it was a good choice...obviously not! We couldn't believe the Donatello was so great and this place totally not! We hope to go back to Napa Valley because it's beautiful & we love great food and wine, but will NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with kitchen and washer/dryer”
Reviews.Author: Calitraveler559
Reviews.Content: We booked through priceline and ended up here in a studio room. Vino Bella is located right next door to The Meritage. It is not in Napa proper, but that was not critical for us as we arranged a car to take us to dinner in Yountville through the concierge at The Meritage. The wine cave there was very casual and laid back, which we appreciated since Napa tends to be busier than Paso Robles or Sonoma. Our room was okay. The air was loud, but air conditioners at hotels tend to be that way. Maid service was not the best...our tub was dirty and there was no way I would have taken a bath in there. I complained to the front desk and they were apologetic. The nice thing about the rooms is that since they are essentially time share, you have a mini kitchenette and washer/dryer. Oh, wireless is included in resort fee, but my iPad would not pick it up in our third floor room.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: Beenaroundtheworld2
Reviews.Content: We stumbled on this through a websited but found it to be a lovely hotel/condo resort. Our room was spacious with a fridge sink etc. We were able to chill wines we bought and there were glasses provided. The resort had a beautiful pool and winery attached. They offered free tastings in their cave at 5 each afternoon. They Staff was friendly although the concierge never followed through on sending me the ways to reserve a driver for touring when I requested it 3 times in advance by phone and email. We did however secure a WONDERFUL driver Donald at Beau Wine Tours and he was spectacular. The hotel was a good price considering it was prime time and we ate breakfast there which was excellent. They offered shuttles to downtown Napa for free which was nice. We really enjoyed it here and would stay again. The lighting was a little dark particularly for 4 women trying to do makeup but that was our only complaint : )

Reviews.Title: “No Repeat Stay”
Reviews.Author: ayoboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vino Bello Resort for 2 nights.The grounds are very nice but the room we stayed was not very pleasant for sleeping as the air conditioner was very loud almost like being in an airplane sitting next to the window where the engines are.Complained to the staff and was told that all the rooms are similar in terms of set up of the air conditioning unit.We felt that we did not get our moneys worth considering we paid $190/night and therefore will not recommend to friends and family and for sure will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Windy236
Reviews.Content: We absolutely had a lovely stay at the Vino Bello Resort. The staff were excellent in every way. The room as requested on the third floor on the cornor to avoid alot of noise was perfect in every way. There was not anything that we could have improved on in this stay. When we called about the airconditioning the staff responded within 5 minutes and had it repaired. The resort goes to a great deal of effort to make your stay perfect as ours was. Would go there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Girltime
Reviews.Content: Really nicely appointed rooms with all amenities. Washer and dryer were a big plus! Friendly staff, very helpful. Decent location, as it is close to Napa city, and access to Highway 29 and Silverado Trail to get up into the valley or to Sonoma too. Room service breakfasts were great! Everything was cooked perfectly. Parking was crowded, but that just means that they are doing a great business!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay! Highly disappointing....Noisy, Noisy, noisy, noisy. Left 1 day early on a 3 night stay.”
Reviews.Author: chevalresque
Reviews.Content: Wow.... I was not expecting to be THIS diasppointed by this one. This was supposed to be my leisure time after my buisness in sacramento. I wanted to pamper myself in what appeared to be a very nice 4 star hotel. I had nowhere to go, I just wanted to relax and enjoy the sights and spa. The pool and spa are quite beautiful. The spa is actually in the cellar, which is a nice touch. The landscaping is very pretty and it is quite enjoyable to walk in the vineyard. But wow, the room was horrible. It is pretty yes... but that is it. Ist was sooo incredibly noisy. I was woken up at 6h00 by the kids in the other room and the cabinet doors in their kitchenne that just echoed in my room. And at night, untill 11h00 it was the TV. The disposition of the rooms make it so that the kitchennettes are on the other rooms wall. And the TV is on the counter, also on the other person's room wall. Usually in high priced hotels (like the hilton where I had a relly really nice stay), the kitchen is on the corridor wall and the TV on an inner wall or an ouside wall to minimise the noise. I had a terrible time and even cut my trip short because of the paper thin walls. It was HORRIBLE. I just couldn't get my basic sleep, and I am on VACATION, in a luxurious hotel... Unacceptable. I had a room on the third floor on my second night after I complained about the noise in my first room the first night (and a free breakfast---which would have been fine if my noise problem had been solved, but it was not. The same thing happened). It seems all rooms are built the same and all poorly insulated. They were kind enough to change my room to one on the top floor, but it was the EXACT same thing. I could hear everything in the other room: their TV, I could even tell which games they were playing with their kids (Simon says, 50 questions)... and they were not screaming, and I was watching TV or in my bed. I could hear them walk---even on the top floor, and the doors of the kitchenettes every time they closed, as they are directly on the other rooms wall, which makes little sence. Even the comfort inn where I stayed many times as a student has better insulation, and it is a budget hotel. The noise kept going till 11h30 and started again in both rooms around 6h00. I just wanted to sleep till 8h00am and I couldn't even do that. I tried to sleep with my earplugs, but I could still hear the loud bangs of the doors and the kitchen cabinets. This is unacceptable for a hotel of this class. UNACCEPTABLE. I stayed 2 nights and left for the third. I could not stand staying one more night. Also there were a lot of minor mishaps with the room itself: We didn't have a clock-radio, and there was no fan over the mini-oven so the hole room smelled. The little fridge in the first room wasn't even bolted to the counter and kept tipping forward. There were no doors in the lower cabinet where the trash cans were. and no pressure in the shower. AND no vanity to put our things because of the pedestal sink, so we had to put them on the side of the tub. Real fancy. This was the first room. The second was fine except the lack of a fan. There should NOT be so much difference amongst rooms of the same category. First room unacceptable for a luxuary hotel, the other was fine. Customer satisfaction should be important to any hotel. Because I complained the very first night and left after the second because of the same situation, any self respecting hotel would reimburse my hole stay. But as I checked-out and complained again, the hotel says it's in the hands of expedia and expedia in the hands of the hotel... and I am in hell. And now after 4 attempts to reach the unreachable manager during the rest of my vacation ---which took about 2h30 of my time---, expedia tells me the Vino BEllo will only reimburse for the night I didn't use, which was a given... but they really don't seem to care about the quality of my stay, after all I did get a free breakfast and a change of rooms. What am I complaining about. So what if I was constantly hearing my neighbours, so what if I couldn't sleep... This would not have been even a question at most hotels and they would have reimbursed me. Afterall, I paid for a luxury hotel and got only 2 star quality (in my room of couse). Usually, hotels have a satisfaction guarantee, but apparently here they do not. So, even with the horrible stay I had, I could not be reimbursed and I stayed 2 nights in 2 different rooms and left the other night I had reserved. That doesn't sound like a happy customer. It is pretty clear. So, if you're a family with small children and get up at 6h00, this hotel might be ok for you. Just pray all goes as planned... but my advise is: stay away from this horrible hotel....

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasatly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: TJnRea
Reviews.Content: The hotel, and its property are beautiful. They have a vineyard on the back side of the hotel, as well as a "cave" tasting room, and wine cellar. The staff were very helpful and friendly. They provide a shuttle to the downtown area between 5 and 10:30 nightly. As well as placing a complimentary bottle of wine in your room!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Amenities, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: orion_8
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a studio room with three other friends at Vino Bello and we were all pleasantly surprised with the hotel. Although the room was MUCH smaller than we anticipated, it was very clean and it looked great. The hotel staff was very nice, and the pools were well maintained. Guests at Vino Bello are allowed to use all of the resort amenities at the Meritage next door, so we spent most of our time in the Meritage pool and spa. Overall, my friends and I had a great experience at this hotel. The only downside is that it is a bit far from most of the wineries and touristy things in Napa, so it might not be the best option for people looking for a close-in resort.

Reviews.Title: “The room are exquisite”
Reviews.Author: JajaLalaMimiEE
Reviews.Content: The 2 room setup are just the way to go with family and friends. The bigger room-The Suite is setup with full kitchen, Laundry closet, Dinning area, Living room with sofa bed, Private plush bedroom with Jacuzzi and the biggest luxury bathroom. Plus you also get your functional balcony with full set of patio furniture great for the awesome Napa outdoor dining both accessible from the main living area and the master bedroom. The smaller suite is enough for 4 with a small kitchenette, minus the jacuzzi. We are planning on coming back as often as we can to this relaxing property. Complimentary wine, Heated Pool with hot tub, Patio area for family grilling, Super kid friendly. If you can sit thru a timeshare presentation and not succumbed to buying then take then up for a 45min talk and get your free stay at some more awesome freebie.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort, versatile location, would recommend for Napa”
Reviews.Author: samthefish06
Reviews.Content: I chose Vino Bello resort for my stay, I was debating b/w this, Embassy Suites, and Hotel Avia. I was staying for 5 nights, to enjoy a leisurely tour of wine country. While some reviewers wrote the location is a con, I found it to be a plus. The resort is 10 minutes drive from downtown Napa, but I enjoyed being away from town. Another plus for me was versatility, having easy access to either Silverado Hwy or Hwy 29. The wineries I wanted to visit are located along both of these, and I would have felt limited if i had to drive a long way to get to the other hwy. The rooms are tastefully decorated, very homey, and full of amenities. We did not have any noise issues as some other reviewers noted, even though the resort did look fully-booked and thus I was concerned. I did call ahead and request a 3rd floor room just in case. I would recommend this resort to other visitors to Napa!

Reviews.Title: “Definition of Leisure”
Reviews.Author: ryanrovesrions
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Bello Vino for a night on the Friday before Valentine's Day. From the moment I walked in, everyone was beyond helpful and friendly. The concierge was so helpful. She gave us suggestions of where to go in wine country but also provided us with free tasting coupons and discounts. They mentioned that there was a complimentary wine and cheese reception that evening and that event did not disappoint! The rooms we got was the one bedroom condo. This place looked exactly like the pictures online. Usually I feel skeptical because hotel pictures are always embellished, but to be honest I think the room in the pictures is not done justice. The jetted tub next to the bed is definitely a plus. They give you robes to use as well. The shower is AMAZING. It is huge and has four additional heads pointing to your body. The room came with a bottle of wine, two sodas and two bottles of water. The kitchen came complete with everything you would need... we just didn't use it. There is a full size washer and dryer for anyone staying for an extended period of time. The grounds are beautiful and the cave is neat. There is a heated pool people were actually swimming in. It's a little bit of a drive for everything north of Napa, but who doesn't enjoy that scenic drive on 29 or the Silverado???

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, well-appointed, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Boester
Reviews.Content: Using a travel-booking website, I bid on a room without knowing the hotel name and was pleasantly surprised when it was revealed as Vino Bello Resort. I called ahead, requested and received a room with a king bed on the top floor. Very new property, I'm guessing the Vino Bello was originally meant to be marketed as a condo or time-share resort, as the room was fully furnished with washer/ dryer and a kitchen with utensils. Fluffy towels and robes, I was in heaven, until: Though clearly not sold-out, I realized they booked me right next door to another couple/ party. Thin walls or just loud neighbors, I called the front desk looking to be relocated, mystified as to why they would put people in rooms right next to each other when the parking lot was near empty. I was moved to a complimentary upgraded suite, complete with fireplace, jacuzzi tub, full kitchen/ bar. I could have stayed forever ... $15 Resort fee included a nice bottle or wine and wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Came back for a second time.”
Reviews.Author: asmile2day
Reviews.Content: My husband, brother and sister in law and myself stayed in Vino Bello during their grape harvest in October. We had stayed there when it first opened and loved it and were excited about sharing our experience. It was just as wonderful as the first time. Great rooms! Everything you could want. This time we had 2 studios as we had plans for eating out at some of the great restaurant. Very comfortable. We also have had a suite which was also outstanding. Suites are great for families that like having a full kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort!”
Reviews.Author: poiboiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 BR Condo and the unit was very beautiful and well appointed. Full kitchen, fireplace, spacious living room, large balcony, beautiful master bedroom, large bath tub with jets, large shower/bathroom area. Perfect for families! You are a few miles from downtown Main Street Napa, but the resort offers free shuttles to town. The Spa is over the top!!! Great resort amenities. Definitely recommended for singles, families, honeymooners, etc. The only downside to my stay was having to check out...wish we stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Wine Country Luxury...a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: jerryftm
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel...our room had a complete kitchenette in it, along with a washer and dryer. Great service, comfort, and surroundings. Good value for the dollar. But if you're a visitor to wine country, it's a bit of a drive to all the wineries. We'd stay here again, but the location (at the very southern end of Napa Valley) is something of a concern.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay except for the thin walls and celing!”
Reviews.Author: headmofo1
Reviews.Content: A previous review of the Vino Bello Resort was very accurate. For a fairly new facility the walls and ceiling should be better insulated. We booked their standard room on priceline. When we got to the resort we upgraded to the condo. The condo itself is great, but we had a rough time sleeping because we were on the second of three floors and the person (s) above us was up at 4:00 a.m. stomping around. I would stay at the resort again BUT only on the top floor!

Reviews.Title: “It has 2 things I hate: thin walls & timeshare!”
Reviews.Author: oreoiii
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 days/2 nights. Â  We got the room through Hotwire which meant we did not know the hotel just the rating which was 4 stars. Â We got the standard room. I give the hotel 2 stars not 4. Â By appearance alone, the hotel was nice. Â But there were too many negatives for me that dropped it down to 2 stars.Â  1. Â The walls and ceiling are too thin. Â We could hear the people talking and the tv from the rooms on both sides of the wall. Â We could here the people walking above us. Â We could also hear the dryer from another room. Â If this place was 50 years old I'd understand the thin walls, but this building is less than 5 years old, that's inexcusable. Â This is the main reason why I rate this hotel low. 2. Â There were ants in the bathroom. Â We called front desk and someone did come to spray the sink with bug spray within 20 minutes. Â But the ants came back. 3. Â This place is a timeshare. Â I hate the sales pitch for timeshares. Â The concierge asked us to see her after we checked in. Â We did thinking we could get some good suggestions as to where to go. Â We were hit with the sales pitch, she tried to get us to go to the timeshare presentation then gave us some suggestions. Â How times do I have to say I'm not interested before you stop asking? 4. Â There was a $20 resort fee per night which they only charged $15. Â We were charged $30 total. Â This includes a bottle of wine and 2 waters & 2 Pepsis for 2 days. Â My complaint is that this should be included in our purchase through Â Hotwire (yes, I know that Hotwire provides a warning about this before making the purchase, but this artificially gives a lower price for this hotel!). 5. Â There isn't enough parking as a previous person mentioned. Â The staff appear to park in the street. Â We came back around 8:00pm and got the last spot near our room. Â There was a party at the hotel and the guests of the party were taking up the guest parking. 6. Â The place is still under construction, but we didn't see or hear any of it. Â Some of rooms in the hotel were not complete and they were clearing out dirt to build another building. Â I can imagine it getting noisy! 7. Â There was this extra hallway/entry to get to the room. Â As we got off the elevator, we walked down the hallway to the door of our room and opened it with our card key. Â When we opened the door we found a small entry with two doors for two different rooms and used our card key again to get to our room. The problem with this is that you can't hear people knocking on the first door if you are in the room. I find no good reason for this. Â Instead of spending money on this wasted space, why not soundproof your walls! 8. Â Distance. Â Other reviewers complained about how far the hotel was. Â The hotel is south of wineries in Napa. Â If you hate driving then this place isn't for you. Â The hotel is about 10-15 minutes from the city of Napa, about 15-20 minutes to Yountville with no traffic and 45 minutes to the CIA with no traffic. I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “The Pinnacle of Service, Accommodation, Friendliness & Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: hyyield63
Reviews.Content: Our stay was "kick-started" by Elisse W's amazing service to get our accommodations tailored to our need. She booked us one night at Meritage Hotel and the balance of our stay (the remaining 7 nights) at the one-bedroom condo in Vino Bello. She even arranged for the arrival of our luggage in advance through UPS so that it was there waiting for us at the front desk! We were greeted by Tony, our bellman, who was fantastic and friendly. When we got to the front desk, our names were proudly displayed in a frame, congratulating us on our recent marriage..and to our surprise, Tony handed us a freshly printed copy as a keepsake before we thought to request it! WOW! Next, we coordinated the majority of our trips through Rosemary, who was as sweet as she was efficient! She actually got us a couples massage at Spa Terra even though we understood them to be booked out the day we wanted to visit! She saved us a great deal in expenses, ensuring we got the best rates on everything from drivers, cabs, and even car rental. She was truly a connected gal with lots of great insight on the area. She was a blessing for us to work with. Jessica at Spa Terra was also accommodating, as it was her help that landed us at Spa Terra for our special spa day. We can't say enough about the staff, the condo at the Vino Bello, the people here, and Michael the GM, whom we bumped into in the Tasting Room at the resort. From Tony to Michael, from Chloe to Elisse, everyone was so wonderful and really bent over backwards to take care of our every wish.

Reviews.Title: “Felt more like a home than a resort”
Reviews.Author: NathAus
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in a luxurious one bedroom condo at Vino Bello which was spacious, clean and modern. The suite was equipped with all amenities you would need, from kitchen to laundry to bathroom to make the stay as convenient as possible; and the bathroom was huge and featured a hot tub. We had no noise during our stay and really felt like we were in our own private holiday house. As a bonus, their Spa Terra in the cave is incredible with very friendly and attentive service by staff. The main complaint people seem to have is that the resort is just outside of Napa. Yes, it is but this adds to the resort's seclusion. Besides, the resort offers a complimentary shuttle that runs into downtown, but chances are you have driven to Napa so you would expect to drive when exploring downtown and other wineries in nearby Yountville and St. Helena anyway. The Vino Bello Resort proved to be luxurious without being pretentious and perfect for a relaxing getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with AMAZING spa in the cave”
Reviews.Author: a786374534
Reviews.Content: A truly amazing resort in Napa Valley. We were there mid-week and it felt it belonged to us - attentive service, empty spa area and restaurant (great food also!). Pool and hottub open until late - and also empty. However, spa (inside an underground wine cave) is truly amazing. BTW, on top of all the above, it has its own winery tasting room. Will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Parking and Customer Service Won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: zmaranello
Reviews.Content: We booked this accommodation on a site where you have to commit and pay before you can see the name of the 'hotel' The location is south of downtown Napa and is not convenient to what we wanted to see. Parking is insufficient for the number of units that the property has, and another building is under construction but there is no additional parking. We had to park on a dark, un-lit street. We called to notify the front desk that parking was a problem and had a very bad experience. We called and tried to speak to them in a polite manner, but they were unapologetic, interrupted my wife and I and had no interest in hearing about the problem. They acknowledged parking was a problem and seconds later denied that it was a problem. When we stated we had to park on the street far away from our building they said it was not their problem and that they would need to call the city. Eventually they offered to come get our keys and valet the car. In order to get it the next day we would have to walk another 200 yards up to the main office, so it seemed pointless to take their offer, plus we did not want to have to deal with them any further. Customer Service does not appear to be a priority for this property. We will not be staying here again and would not recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Really luxurious resort style hotel”
Reviews.Author: whchuang
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a 2 bedroom condo for one night, with me, my wife, my daughter (5 years old), and my mother-in-law (80 years old). I think all of us had a great time. The room is REALLY luxurious, the building materials are all top notch - very nice kitchen cabinets, appliances, bath tubs, stand-up shower, etc. Very detail-oriented and very nice interior design. However, We did notice some ants coming out from the jacuzzi hot tub, but given that lots of people came here for wine tasting tours (sweet wines?), I guess that's somewhat acceptable...The location of the hotel is not ideal as another reviewer mentioned, but it's not that bad as it's only 10 minutes drive to Napa downtown and 40 minutes to Calistoga. The heated swimming pool is wonderful, and if you come during summer time with young children, your children will LOVE the small water playground right next to the swimming pool.. it's a nice surprise to us. They also provide BOTH "free" wired ethernet connection Internet AND wireless Internet, which is a big plus for us (well technically it's not really "free" as they charge your with resort fee, and the Internet is probably included in the resort fee). Overall, we love our stay here and probably will come back here again next summer (if the price is right)...

Reviews.Title: “Pretty...but pretty far too!”
Reviews.Author: Maddogmads
Reviews.Content: Pretty rooms.... but just too far from anything to do with Napa, St. Helena and Yountville wineries! We went with another couple so we were fortunate to have a two-bedroom suite which allowed for us to have a full kitchen, living room and 2 master suites. Roomy, great comfy beds and all the amenities you could ask for. It ends there though. It was just too far from anything we wanted to experience in Napa. All wineries were at least a 30 minute drive and unless you are preparing food in your room or eating at their restaurant, you can plan on a hike for meals as well. We got smart though. At first we would tour the wineries all day, drive all the way back to the resort to change and then back to town for dinner. By day two, we knew enough to bring a change of clothes for dinner and we slipped them on in the car - that saved about a 40 minute trip each way. Truly 40 minutes from Mustard's Grill for example. If you expect the front staff to be efficient you will be disappointed. I pre-checked in at 10:00AM and left my bags to be delivered to my room when it was ready. I returned to the hotel at 4:30, my bags were no where to be found, my reservation (which I confirmed early was 2 rooms) only had 1 room - and I had to wait to have management fix my reservation. They did give me 2 free breakfast coupons for my inconvenience though. We typically stay in Yountville amongst all the things the wine country is known for but it was all booked due to crush. I do not believe I will stay here again only for the mere disappointment of location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Service!”
Reviews.Author: jojolina
Reviews.Content: The service I received her was second to none. All staff that I came in contact with, from the front desk, doorman, housekeeping, room service, restaurant, spa was absolutely excellent! We've stayed here before and love the rooms and surroundings. The vineyards growing above the hotel are beautiful. The pools are lovely. The spa is incredible!!! As always the air conditioner is loud. The only thing I would change is that I wish their restaurant menu was bigger and the room service choices definitely need to be expanded. From what I hear they are hiring a new chef and this will happen in the near future. I am so happy to have a Shell Property of this caliber available to me. Thanks Vino Bello and Meritage Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: glinco
Reviews.Content: Had a large, one bedroom suite. Need ADA access and the roll in shower was great. Some turns were a bit tight getting into the room but we managed. Bed was a bit high for transfers. Resort is located convenient to the wineries and restaurants in Napa. Also relatively easy to cut over to Sonoma. Staff was very friendly and helpful. All requests handled very quickly and efficiently. As we were there for the wineries and restaurants, we didn't spend a lot of time at the resort. However, room was great and served us well. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiMochi
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and his family and we booked 3 one bedroom suites. Pros: The resort was quite and peaceful. The rooms were IMMACULATE; clean, super spacious, and filled with everything you would possibly need including a washer and dryer, detergent, a blender, stove, etc. The bathroom was gorgeous and about the same size as the bedroom. There was 9 of us on this trip and we thought we needed 3 rooms but we realized that each suite was definitely more than enough space for 4 person per room. Swimming pool was nice and had a little bbq area for you if you wanted to cook. Parking is free and huge so you don't have to worry about your car being too far from your room; there is always a spot near your room. Cons: It's very far from most of the wineries. The wine at the resort was horrible! The resort provides each room with a complimentary wine bottle plus a two for the price of 1 wine tasting deal. The tasting room was very disappointing; it was small and empty (we later found out why) and the wine bartender is incompetent. She simply read the wine labels to us and recited a descriptions which she memorized but was unable to explain. She was not able to answer any questions about any of the wines served. I didn't like any of the wines served but I'm wondering if it's even fair to say that since the bartender's lack of experience serving definitely tainted the taste of the wines. I didn't like my first wine but almost finished it and asked for the next tasting, she simply poured the next bottle into the same cup without rinsing. I let it go thinking it was an accident and that she was in a hurry to serve others. However, the second tasting was horrible and I asked for the next one without finishing the second tasting and the bartender mixed the wines! She simply poured the third tasting into the same glass. When I complained, she dumped the wine mix but did not rinse the glass. The bartenders in the actually bar area was more skilled but had an attitude when I requested that she adjusted my drink a little to my taste. The food was mediocre; the location was too far to go out and eat so we decided to buy grocery and cook for the rest of our stay which was fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but Napa is Crapa”
Reviews.Author: DaveNBPT
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why people would want to stay in Napa. It's largely devoid of decent restaurants (ones that aren't overpriced or overhyped), and the town itself seems like something that is in need of a little TLC. What tourists really want is St. Helena, up the road a bit. We made the mistake of staying in Napa for 3 nights, one of which was at this hotel. This isn't really a hotel, though, it's a time share resort that has a hotel facility. The rooms are obviously condos that are being rented out to tourists like myself. No problem there, just letting you know what to expect. The "resort" sits in a business park, off of one of the main roads that leads into Napa. It's a mile or two into town, though, so don't think this is "in town." The free bottle of wine they give you upon your arrival is not worth opening. Seriously, pour it down the drain. You're in Napa Valley to drink some of the world's greatest wines, and this swill is an insult to wine. The room is brand new and decorated in what I might call "suburban traditional American" with granite countertops and cherry cabinets in the open kitchen area in front of the bed. The sound insulation to the inner hallway is fantastic -- there's the equivalent of an airlock you have to enter to get into the room through two sets of doors. Which shows the builders gave a lot of attention to details like noises from outside your unit. Too bad the builders gave no attention to details of noises *inside* your unit, like the AC unit. With the unit on, it sounded like a little tornado in your room. Great while you're awake -- lousy for a good night's sleep. It was hot while we were in the valley, so we had no choice but to suffer through the constant wakings . Everything else was top notch. So much so that we thought, what the heck, we'd stay here for another 2 nights. No go, though. Even though other websites showed the resort still had rooms available (at a much higher, different rate), the hotel's own block of rooms were all taken. Odd that they couldn't see that they still had unsold inventory available they couldn't make available to us. So we had to move on to the Marriott, which turned out to be a much better value (and just as enjoyable stay, without the tornado AC unit in the room). One last thing... We ate the on-site restaurant after trying to partake of some food in downtown Napa. What a mistake that turned out to be! Needless to say, downtown Napa is something you could avoid and not miss a thing. The resort's on site restaurant turned out to be a pleasant surprise -- outstanding meal served in an elegant but casual atmosphere. The Internet connection in our room was sketchy at best. We expected better for a resort of this caliber, and could do nothing more than try and check our emails. I would never buy a condo or time share at a place like this, but I can understand why some people would. As a hotel, it's a pretty good stay. But it's on the south side of town, while all the wineries are more up north. Stay north or in a B&B while visiting the Napa Valley if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a fabulous setting”
Reviews.Author: mb65
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. The rooms are lovely with a great bath, kitchenette or full kitchen, and patio in each. The staff and concierge were helpful. The hotel is surrounded by vineyards and even has an onsite tasting room. In addition the restaurant on site is very good.

Reviews.Title: “A+”
Reviews.Author: Wine_n_Dine22
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place. Beautiful, well equiped rooms. Quiet, simple pool and hot tub with complementary ice cold lemonade provided. The restraunt mixes a stiff mimosa -- which is the way I prefer ; ) I don't understand the complaints on location (e.g. "business park"). It borders a vineyard, and is maybe 5 minutes from downtown Napa. If you have a rental car, I'd say this is a prime location.

Reviews.Title: “VINO BELLO - A*M*A*Z*I*N*G”
Reviews.Author: rkellitrip
Reviews.Content: I would not normally take the time to review a hotel but I had such a great experience I felt the need to write about it! The grounds were well groomed and taken care of. There were a lot of people staying there and we didn't hear a lot of noise and there were so many people willing to take care of our every need. This was our first trip to Napa for wine tasting and the concierge really knew what she was talking about and gave some great advise on where to go all while taking in the amount of time we were there for. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “I won't go back”
Reviews.Author: lovingsonoma
Reviews.Content: I was in the Chardonnay building. There is only one elevator for the entire building. I was placed in a studio. Room was fine. It and the bathroom were a bit dark. It was difficult to climb over the tub wall to take a shower. A/C was VERY loud. My biggest take away was paper thin walls. I could hear both rooms next to me and those above and below me. AWFUL!! Location is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Brenda29
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort with very helpful staff, free internet and shuttle bus to downtown napa. The only downside is you need a car or use the shuttle bus to get to local shops

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Wine”
Reviews.Author: Phoenixreviewer
Reviews.Content: We reserved a Resort King Suite, but got upgraded to a very spacious 836sq ft. 1 bedroom unit. There were 4 of us. We were in the Chardonnay wing overlooking the pool area. The Meritage Resort & Spa houses the front desk/lobby,meeting space,Siena Restaurant, Meritage bar, & Trinitas tasting room/cave. There is a $15./night resort fee which includes local phone calls,800 calls,resort business center use,high speed internet wired and wireless via ATT, M-F USA Today newspaper,fitness center,pool & jacuzzi use(outdoor), 1 bottle of wine, and canned soda and bottled water replaced daily. The 1 bedroom condo has a King bed in the bedroom with a jetted tub seperated by a half wall. 1 flat sceen TV & a large closet. The bathroom is accessible from the bedroom or the hallway. There are double sinks,toilet, and a very large shower with body sprays. There is a balcony patio accessible from the living room and bedroom with a table and chairs as well as a bench sofa type chair. The full kitchen has Whirlpool appliances. There is a coffee maker in the room with coffee. There are 2 bar stools. The sofa makes into a queen size bed,not too bad with reguard to the comfort level. There is also 2 club chairs a few end tables and a flat screen tv. The fireplace in the living room was a nice feature. Just flip the switch on the wall. There is a washing machine & a dryer right when you enter,with complimentary laundry soap. The staff just could not do enough to please us and were very prompt in doing so. It is at the South end of Napa( to get to Vino off Hwy 121/29 which is also Soscol Avenue)take Napa Valley Corporate way),but only about a 10min. ride to town. There are a few restaurants on Hwy 121/29.( to get to Vino off Hwy 29/12 take Soscol Ferry Rd to Napa Valley Corp.) Hwy 121/29 and 29/12 run parallel to each other. The onsite restaurant for breakfast was just what we needed to start our day before heading out to the vineyards for tastings. The Resort King Suite and the Resort double suites are about 493 sq. ft. Probably good for 2 people. They tried to tell us upon check in that the double beds were actually queen beds,not so. We actually went to the room.This was really our only negative. I highly recommend this resort. Parking is complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: bmartens1913
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon from March 14th-March 18th. It was 70 and sunny the entire week. The 1 bedroom condo we stayed in was amazing. Tile floors, full kitchen, Jacuzzi in the bedroom, huge shower, and great scenery from the balcony. We thought the service was perfect and the amenities were incredible. I give the place an A, but not an A+ only because of the restaurant. One night the service was very poor and both nights the food wasnâ€™t the best. However, the manager gave us free breakfast because of the poor service. We definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a nightmare...stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: nicolemn
Reviews.Content: Well, let's start with the good points....the room was clean upon arrival. Okay, now that that's done... This hotel is in a terrible location, it is far away from all of the Napa and Sonoma vineyards, and all of the good restaurants.
