Their web sight offered a $75 discount off your stay while using any of their facilities on property as long as you were staying Sunday through Thursday. We arrived on a Tuesday @ 11:30 a.m. and inquired how the discount would be applied. The counter clerk went in to ask the Manager with our printout of the offer in hand and came back and said the offer would not be applied because we booked our room on line and should have applied for it at that time. When I asked to speak to the Manager (Robert Witcher) the clerk went into his office and said hew was no longer available that he was now at lunch. This entire transaction took place from about 2 minutes from the time we arrived ,and at no time did anyone ever leave the managers office to leave for lunch. Mr. Witcher was simply too big of a whimp to come out and explain the bait and switch on his own and undoubtedly left his clerk to cover for him. A simple explanation would have sufficed but the manger could have cared less.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: tammilip
Reviews.Content: After reading various reviews of Vino Bello, we, a group of 4 couples, decided to go ahead with our reservation. The biggest drawback in the reviews was the location in an industrial park. However, once you pulled up in front of The Meritage (sister hotel) you would never know where you were. All of the staff were exceptional! The concierge helped us plan our wine tastings weeks before we arrived. The units are roomy and the bathroom was AMAZING! We went on to Pebble Beach from Napa and the bathrooms at The Lodge at Pebble Beach cannot compare to those at Vino Bello. The location is also great if you are planning to visit both Napa and Sonoma. All 8 of us would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS THE WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: shaggydog21
Reviews.Content: This is the absolute worst hotel I have ever dealt with. Originally I was supposed to travel with a few girlfriends, but it ended up being just myself and one friend. She had a family emergency and I called six weeks ahead of time to ask to change my date of travel. Not only do they not give a refund, they do not make any changes regardless of the circumstances. If I had been able to change my stay to two weeks later, I could have come with my friend and two others. They lost out on some good business, and I have told all my friends never to stay there so they will lose that business too. What kind of hotel does not accept changes with so much advance notice? They are terrible. Not only this, but when I emailed the concierge about shuttle transportation from the airport, they gave me a number and said they booked me. I called the number and it was a limosine for two hundred dollars! The regular shuttle was only twenty-nine. How could they think if I was coming by myself that I would want to spend two hundred dollars?!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable accommodations”
Reviews.Author: ccorum
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends for a "girls weekend" in Napa. This was a great option for three of us. We had a spacious one bedroom condo. Many other resorts and hotels we contacted limited occupancy to 2 to a room. The accommodations were luxurious. We had a fireplace and a full kitchen. We used the fitness facilities and I wish we had had time to hang out around the pool. We had access to the amenities of the fully staffed Meritage hotel next door. The only disadvantage was that this facility was located a bit out from town. Given all the driving one has to do in Napa, it was a non-issue. I would highly recommend this facility and hope I will have a chance to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscan Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Stacerator
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vino Bello approximately one and a half years ago and was hesitant about returning since my experience at that time was horrible. The Resort had a lot of service related problems. However, I decided to take a chance and book a return trip to see if the service had improved. I was delighted to see more service staff on the grounds including people working the front desk, more concierges and more bellman, etc. The rooms at the Vino Bello are incredible. The rooms are one of the reason I decided to take another chance on this resort. The only down side of the resort in my opinion is the workout facilities. The workout facility at the Vino Bello needs weights and aerobic machines with individual TV's built in. When there are numerous people in the fitness room, it gets crowded and people are fighting for the TV remote. The fitness room at the sister hotel, The Meritage is OK, but needs to be larger to accomodate the number of people that work out in the mornings. We used both and we were glad to see the fitness centers busy, but both fitness rooms need improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Some people are just NEVER satisfied...”
Reviews.Author: 2wedinmexico07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned a few days ago from our trip to Healdsburg/Napa; the first "leg" of our tour we stayed in Healdsburg, and stayed at the Vino Bello resort for just two days on our second "leg". It's funny reading other reviews...there is just no satisfying some people! Our overall experience was great; we thought the room was fabulous (we had a suite)-perfect for anyone planning to stay more than a few days (full refrigerator, full kitchen, living room, laundry, etc.). The decorating was tasteful and "homey" and there was plenty of space to unwind. I'd say that the only room which was "tight" was the bedroom, but only so because of the dresser (which is VERY nice to have, as I tend to like to unpack, no matter HOW long we're staying!) took up some of the space. We took advantage of booking our stay online directly from the Shell Vacations site and received a $75 "resort credit" for doing so. This credit can be applied towards the spa and/or the restaurant, Siena, located in the Meritage. On the second night of our stay we decided to take advantage of the restaurant so we could use our credit. We opted to sit outside next to the really warm propane fire pit! I would agree with what some others have said about the restaurant...the food was very good, however, we waited EXTREMELY long for our meals (close to 40 minutes!). Fortunately we did each have a glass of wine to enjoy while we waited, which the restaurant/server kindly "treated" us to for our patience. We probably would have tried dessert, but were concerned about how long it would have taken (at that point it was close to 10:00 p.m.) I would also agree that the wine list was somewhat pricey, and frustrating that Siena was charging MORE for the same wines which they serve in their cave/tasting room! The pool was gorgeous, although we didn't find much time to enjoy it. Another disappointment was the fact that the jacuzzi was out of service during our stay (we could have walked over to the Meritage but the jacuzzi was a popular place there!), and I very much enjoy unwinding in the jacuzzi after a long day of tasting. Oh well. I also took advantage of the fitness center during our stay. Although small, it was probably adequately sized for the size of the resort. When I was there, there were 3 other people working out (they had 2 treadmills, 3 ellipticals, and 2 bicycles) and we were all very comfortable. (It did get HOT in there...not sure if we could have turned up the air or something...) I typically run outside when I'm at home, but, since the resort is located within a corporate park, it wasn't a terribly scenic place for a run. Through talking to some locals at the wineries, we understand that there are plans for many more wineries within the vicinity of Vino Bello, which would be great. We didn't mind the drive into downtown Napa, it was a very quick ride and not an inconvenience at all (we had a rental car). The noise: no complaints. Perhaps the air conditioner was a little loud when it kicked on and you were watching TV, but I'm only remembering that now since reading other reviews (i.e. it didn't bother me while we were there). The only other time we heard people moving about was in the morning as everyone was going up/downstairs and heading to that day's destinations. Again, no problem. We would stay here again, and I think it's fabulous that, upon return home from our stay, we received an email from the resort encouraging us to post our reviews. That shows me that they are reading, and value, what we all have to say. Very nice. :)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible AC noise and no soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: DRPETE24
Reviews.Content: They are stretching the definition of "suite"--basically a hotel room with a pullout couch. No chest of drawers to unpack your stuff--we put it in the tiny kitchen cabinets The worst problem is the AC noise--if you are a light sleeper, forget about it. You cannot hear the TV when the AC kicks in. Folks across the hall said they could not regulate theirs and were freezing to death. On the bright side there is a small fridge, coffee maker and microwave. And a washer-dryer(what for in this tiny space?) No sound proofing whatsoever--you can listen to your neighbors as well as the folks above. The "jacuzzi" is a small oval tub with no jets. The place is poorly built---the doors don't hang properly and the bathroom drawer hits the door molding!! It is also noisy with lots of kids and people coming and going. We had a great trip except for the accommodations--what a disappointment for our anniversary trip. Very expensive to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, good price, awesome service - unbelievable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: clark15
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay; very clean, great restaurant, more than one pool. Spa was in a cave and really neat. The resort is relatively close to all the wineries. The concierge is very helpful and will help find activities for you and/or the kids. They will also arrange to ship home the many bottles/cases of wine that you decide to pick up while in Napa. Overall, an amazing place. Our family will be staying there every time we travel to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: RosieCharlie
Reviews.Content: We had called ahead of time to see if we could get an early check-in since we had a concert to attend that evening in Napa. The front desk said they couldn't guarantee an early check-in but that we would be in our room no later than 4pm. We arrived at around 4pm; not only was the room not ready but the woman at the front desk said she didn't know how long it would take, and that there was nothing she could do about it. She repeatedly told us we bought our room on expedia so she had no control over the room (????) She said we could get changed in the public restroom and that she would call us when the room was ready. Needless to say, we never received a call and didn't get into our room until close to 5pm. When I actually did get my key, she asked to see my ID (after I had already given her my credit card and dealt with her for about 20 minutes). On the way to the car to retrieve our bags, we were accosted by the concierge who wanted us to attend a time share presentation. She gave us a hard sell and told us it was an "invitation only" presentation and if we didn't respond then, she couldn't guaranty a spot. We told her we weren't interested and she continued to pursue. At this point, we had no room, no indication of when we'd get in the room, and a woman trying to make us go to a time share presentation for a hotel we were treated badly at. This was overall an incredibly disappointing experience and I'd recommend AGAINST going to this hotel. In addition, it is in a commercial office park area and lacks the charm of Napa. This place sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant beautiful and immaculate, nice on site amenities.”
Reviews.Author: serioushomecook
Reviews.Content: We chose the resort based on internet photos and info, and were not disappointed. The resort is only 2 years old so everthing was beautifully maintained and sumptious. We stayed in a one bedroom suite w/ a kitchen lvg room and dining area which accomodated a family of four nicely. Our comfortable bedroom had a jacuzzi tub in it which was great for soaking w/ a bottle of wine, and the TV swiveled so we could watch TV in the TUB. I loved that. Also the balcony was nice for dining or morning coffee. The on site restaurant was excellent, although service was a little slow,but great if you wanted to relax. Also the wine I found to be a little on the expensive side. I had a massage at the beautiful and incredibly serene on site spa, even my therapist was gorgeous (wish I could mention his name)! The pool and Jacuszzi was very nice, there is one for each building, so never too crowded, and the pool towels were a nice plus. My only issue is that being new to Napa, I did no know that the vinewyards were a good 25 mins from this location, so the driving got old after a while. Next time I will stay in St. Helena, where most of the action is, and is excrutiatingly charming.

Reviews.Title: “1 Bedroom Suite - Awesome Room, Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Onie13
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night here on a Wednesday late April, paid $A224 which included the "resort fee" and got free bottle of wine. We stayed in the 1 bedroom Suite which was massive, it had a full kitchen which we used, then a lounge area with large LCD. The bathroom was also massive and awesome shower with multiple shower heads and then a main bedroom with huge comfy bed and spa bath. Small balcony also off bedroom. Very good price for what we got! We didnt use pool but it looked lovely. Check in was simple and quick. We checked in about 3pm Only negative was we requested a crib on booking and no crib in room, so rang up to get one and they said they would get us one, we went out and got back around 3 hrs later and no crib so had to call up 2 more times to get one and baby quite tired by this stage. Also place seemed a bit sterile and no "cosy/romantic" type place but more business like. Room had a washing machine and dryer in it which was great and got free washing powder. Overall was very happy with nights stay especially at price we paid as room was huge and had everything you could need.

Reviews.Title: “Poor construction and bad service”
Reviews.Author: Tubaman543
Reviews.Content: We went to the Vino Bello for a timeshare presentation, which was bad enough by itself. I am trying not to let the memory of the presentation doesn't taint my review of the hotel... First, the good: The bed was excellent. It was extremely comfortable, and quite soft; a good way to relax. The hot tub/pool area was also quite nice. I enjoyed the size of the tub, as well as the fact that there were BBQ grills for guests to use. Now for the not so good: The location of the resort is pretty bad, looking out over a corporate office park instead of vines and valley like many other Napa Resorts that cost the same amount per night. Also, the overall construction of the hotel was pretty low. The walls and ceilings were quite thin, allowing nose from rooms around you to leak in quite easily. We unfortunately happened to get put in a room right next to a family with young children who didn't like to sleep...not good. When we called the front desk to switch, they were not amenable to the request, saying that they were totally full and then hanging up on us. After that, the rest of our customer service experience was pretty poor. When we called to have some missing items brought to our room, it took them 25 minutes and 2 further calls to bring them to us. The concierge was very inattentive, paying more attention to the older guests, as we were one of the youngest couples there. Finally, the same was true of the wait staff at the bar and the restaurant. Both times, our waiter forgot about us more than once. We just felt like we were being overlooked. I am glad that I did not pay the $350+ per night that would be normal without the presentation package. If I had been paying that much, I would have been even more upset, because at those prices, you expect 5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “You gotta stay in the One Bedroom Condo!!”
Reviews.Author: kprecious
Reviews.Content: I brought my husband here for a few days of relaxation. He didnt even drink wine before coming to Napa but he does now!! We stayed in a One Bedroom and whike I was hesitant to spend the extra money after reading some past reviews, it was well worth it. We spent hours sitting on the balcony drinking our wine and enjoying the time and atmosphere. The room looked just like the pictures on the website. The jacuzzi tub in the room....well lets say that was the best part of the week! Yes, you can hear alittle noise from the neighbors, but I rarely stay in a hotel where you dont. The Spa is magnificent!! Service was also as we would have expected. I am looking forward to a girls weekend here soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, Service Not So Nice”
Reviews.Author: Meme29
Reviews.Content: Bello is beautiful, but room service is not as grand as the resort. When I first arrived, I called room service to have something delivered to me. Room service never came. I actually had to find a maid out in the hall, cleaning rooms, that could assist me. The second day we were there, I ordered room service at 8:15, room service said it would be 25 to 30 min. before it would arrive, we had a wine tour leaving at ten. I thought that we would have plenty of time to eat breakfast. I had to call and cancel our breakfast at 9:45. Room service did not show nor did they call to say the order would be late. However, the conc. did take care of us. I would recomend this resort for a place to sleep while in Napa, but for service, I would advise going somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice re the Hotel / Spa is a sure thing - July 10, 2008”
Reviews.Author: NORCALMary
Reviews.Content: Hotel room - on the surface it looks inviting, although the construction of the hotel was very cheap. For example, the walls were so thin that I could hear my neighborâ€™s cellular telephone vibrate on the night stand next to the wall near my bed - seriously. Also, the air conditioner was louder then ever - even with ear plugs, you could hear the A/C unit kick-on/off! Food: The food was substandard re quality, overpriced ($32 for chicken - joker) and the service wasn't much better (rough & tough staff). Shame on us, as we ate here a few months ago via a business trip and were hoping it would of change (food & service wise). Still not worthy ~ Chef Ramsey would have ripped this place apart! Hotel Rate/Resort Fee: Purchased the room via Priceline for $133 plus tax & service fees. The hotel still requires the guest to pay the $15 per night resort fee. Interesting enough, as the manager was no where to be found and/or reachable to discuss. I also called Priceline immediately (upon arrival) and their Customer Service dept. stated that they could not do anything about this fee and suggested that I send an email to file a complaint. and suggested that I speak to the hotel mgmt. Spa: The staff members (receptionist & massage therapist) & massage services were great. The facility was impeccable - appealing and clean from top to bottom. Very attentive - several attendants spot checked the facility several times per hour. Would return back to the spa for sure. I had a great experience - thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - Definitely not a Four Star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: traveler222_8
Reviews.Content: This is the first time that I have written a review. Beware of this hotel!! We purchased this one night Four Star hotel room on Priceline. It was my first time using Priceline, but I thought that a Four star would be safe. We paid $270 for one night hotel in Napa on Priceline and the room rate is $249 without Priceline and tax. Furthermore, the hotel is located on the Other Side of the Bridge, far away from everything. Upon obtaining the name of the hotel I went to their website and was informed that the hotel is under construction. I am taking this up with Priceline, since they should not refer people to hotels with construction without FIRST informing them. I called three times to the hotel and they could not find my reservation. They finally called me at 6pm on the arrival day and told me that they found it. I was told over the telephone that I could bring my 13 year old daughter to the spa. We went early that morning and I was told that no children are allowed. The air conditioning in the room was like an airplane taking off every 10 minutes. This occurred all night long!!. We were able to hear the loud family upstairs until 1am and again in the morning. They had a child who ran back and forth throwing himself/herself on the floor. Big Booms. The maintenance at this hotel is horrible; the bathroom vent is clogged with dust hanging from it. We even had the room service man listen to the A/c and he jumped back when the a/c made the noise while he was delivering the breakfast. I contacted the Asst. Manager in the morning and asked him to come to witness the situation; however, he told me that he would speak to the Manager during the week about giving me a night stay in the future. I called and left messages for him for 2 weeks and got no response. I spoke to another Manager who told me that he would check into it and get back to me, but never did. I finally called the general manager and was told that these issues do not warrant an offer other than crediting me for $19 room service charge! He said that they can't do anything about the noise from other rooms and they might have had a repair man come to the room to service the air conditioning in the middle of the night. This is a hotel room, can you imagine a repairman working on your air conditioning unit in your room while you are in your PJ's in the middle of the night and having all of the dust from opening the unit on top of your Bed!! I told him that being in the Residential Property Management Business that I am aware that most places do not even have maintenance personnel on duty during the night and only respond to sprinkler and fire emergencies. My husband does this work and I am a property Manager. The Gen Mgr. agreed to this statement, but didn't comment as to why his Assistant Manager didnâ€™t even come to the room in the morning to review the a/c situation and the noise from the other room. I paid almost $300 for a 4 Star Hotel in a horrible location and this is what they offer. After researching this hotel, I see that this hotel is all over San Francisco as a Time Share Offer. Get 2 nights at VINO BELLA for a cheap rate to view their timeshare. I have been to numerous four star hotels across this country and this is the WORST and management does nothing about your complaint. After being persistent the Gen Mgr offered me a $75 discount to come back during a week night. My rate would be $150 plus tax to spend another night at a resort??? offering horrible customer service, horrible accommodations and has severe maintenance issues. You can stay at the FAIRMONT hotel in Napa for another $50 and be at a RESORT with Great Services and Great Management OR any other four star hotel which will be more than worth the money. I will never again stay at Vino Bello (See other bad reviews of this hotel/resort online! OR the Meritage hotel their next door sister hotel (also has some bad reviews- same management) I am a member of the Preferred Hotel Group and will be forwarding the same comments to them, even though the Gen Mgr told me that their Preferred Status is only for Meritage and not Vino Bello. PS Meritage and Vino Bello both cost about the same price, so Vino Bello is just a time share Lure. BE WARNED!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Vino Bello”
Reviews.Author: UESGG
Reviews.Content: BEST stay, ever! We had a whirlwind trip to Napa but it was great... Given our accommodations at Vino Bello, I wish we knew more people in the area because we had so much space - we could have had a dinner party if we had wanted! While I did not get to explore the grounds or the spa, the absolute best part of the trip was the amazing concierge service leading up to - and during - our trip. I had no idea where to start, in terms of planning tours, etc. but the staff was so friendly and helpful and definitely helped make our trip amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Do you love getting rest and relaxation?”
Reviews.Author: howardhsu
Reviews.Content: Then this place isn't for you. On the other hand, if you're a fan of high pressured timeshare sales and noise-passive walls then boy are you in for a treat! The Vino Bello rooms were designed poorly with large empty foyers between rooms. Each time your neighbor comes or goes, you hear the echoing boom of two doors shutting. The walls are so paper-thin that you hear the footsteps above and the bedroom olympics from the room adjacent to yours (and vice-versa). Even though the property lists within the city limits of Napa, it's actually 3 miles south of Downtown Napa in a business park. There is nothing romantic or Napa-esque about the location. In fact, you're actually between American Canyon and Napa Proper. Their concierge is actually their first point of attack for their timeshare sales. The 90 minute presentation quickly became 180... one no-pressure sales person became three high-pressure sales people. In hindsight, I'd forego the $100 wine dollars and keep my 3 hours of time. They also tell you that you'll get free wine tastings from a list of wineries. Many of them didn't even recognize the voucher. My last complaint is an unauthorized "resort fee" charge on my credit card. I booked with Priceline and it was supposed to be all inclusive. The resort manager, Robert, later admitted it was an issue that was supposed to be worked out between Vino Bello and Priceline (but had failed to do so when I was a guest). He made no attempt to credit the charge. In fact, upon check-in and check-out there was no mention of this charge. Talk about being sneaky... and this coming from a supposed 4 star resort?! The $30 charge wouldn't be as big of a deal if they were up front about it, but they weren't. It was their fault in not clarifying who would be responsible for the charges with Priceline. They shouldn't hold their guests accountable for their contract negotiation shortcomings. On the plus side, it is a new resort. It is very clean and the common area for The Meritage Resort (their sister property) is very inviting. The rooms are large and the kitchenettes are well-stocked with many dining amenities. The furniture in the rooms are sturdy and quite comfortable. There's also a washer and dryer in each room which is a nice bonus. If you're able to get the room for ~$150 to $200 on Priceline and are a heavy sleeper, then I say go for it. Otherwise, I'd pay a little more and stay at another property. As for the timeshare presentation, I personally wouldn't recommend it. The food served was lousy and worse, they just would not relent.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely more than I can ever ask for! Loved it! Will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: m80traveler
Reviews.Content: After hearing a few bad reviews (especially about the service), I was a little hesitant at first. But as of now, I am supremely glad I stayed here. I booked a one bedroom suite for my girlfriend and I on our anniversary, and we both absolutely loved the place. First, the price is extremely reasonable, considering what other hotels are charging for rooms that aren't even half as big or offer as many amenities. After staying here I thought this room was such a bargain. Second, it's so well furnished, clean and up-to-date. From the flat screen TV's in both rooms, to the upscale and very modern appliances, you never get the feeling that the hotel is old or used. Everything was incredibly clean and in excellent condition. I didn't believe the pictures on the website at first, but that's exactly what my room looked like. Third, the premises are really nice. The pool and jacuzzi at both the Vino Bello and the Meritage (which is right next door) are both really nice and clean. Everything around is well upkept and modern. We didn't even get to try to their famous Spa Terra, and still we loved the place. At the end of the day, my girlfriend and I couldn't stop raving about how we would love to live in an apartment just like this place. It's so perfect in so many ways. The square footage of our suite was incredible and such an absolute steal for what we actually paid. The shower and bathroom is huge, and the bed is immensely comfortable. I heard some people complain about the location, but I actually liked it. Everything is close (provided you have a car). We actually only had to drive 5 minutes to the nearest Raley's to pick up some food to cook. Also, given that the resort is in the middle of a corporate area, it's extremely quiet and secluded. It just adds to the feel that you're own little getaway. Also, contrary to previous reviews, it seems as if they solved their customer service problem because I experienced no such thing. But maybe I just got lucky. Overall, I highly recommend this place. I'm looking forward to staying here again =)

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: mike9152
Reviews.Content: vino bello is a beautiful new resort located in a business park. I was a little concerned when i realised this was a time share i have had a bad experience at another time share but not here! the room was super clean & comfortable down comforters & pillow top beds. The room was a little narrow but overall very nice. we had a third floor room that looked over the pool. the staff was very friendly & helpful. I was a little concerned after reading some of the other reviews but was very satisfied overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, service needs help”
Reviews.Author: OCtravelers7
Reviews.Content: Check in & check out was very easy, we got a great room, 3rd floor view of the pool. Room looked exactly as it does on-line. Location is the very south end of Napa, a bit of a drive, but that is OK. We were very happy with the accomodations, except for the lack of hot water. It took a long time for the running water to heat up, Ok for the shower (such a waste of water though, esp considering the drought in California), but made it very challenging to wash dishes (we had the condo with the full kitchen). Housekeeping was great, room was very clean every day and they ran the dishwasher for us when we were gone. The place was very well stocked. We were very satisfied with the accomodations. We were very disappointed in the service on 2 occassions. 1st, we were expecting an overnight UPS package, we notified the Front Desk twice to let them know to expect it. Per their own policy, it should be delivered to our room w/in 1/2 hr of their receipt. At the time of our 2nd call, the resort had already signed for the package (we didn't know at the time). At the end of the day, when we returned to our room, no package. We called and told them it had been signed for (looked it up ourselves on the UPS website). They then discovered that the sales office signed for it, didn't notify anyone of its arrival and it is sitting on someone's desk and we have to wait until morning to get it. I thought this was unacceptable and that they didn't even try to remedy the situation. Long story short, I went personally to the front desk, told them about my disappointment, apparently, they did have the key and they were able to access the package and we got it that night. I don't think a guest should have to walk down there to ask this as they obviously didn't even try the first time. Someone paid good money to have a package overnighted to a guest (the package was clearly addressed with our guest room #) and someone just decides to let it sit and not deliver it?? 2nd issue, we called the concierge to find out where the nearest urgent care or emergency room was, we thought we were going to need it for our son. We ended up just leaving our vacation a day early instead to go to our local doctor, but we never heard back from ANYONE regarding our question. If a guest is asking about an emergency room, don't you think someone should return that call? Even if it isn't until the next day just to see if there is anything they could do to help. Their lack of effort was REALLY disappointing to us.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Tawplr
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms and resort. However terrible service! Room service messed up several orders and even had to call three times to an order delived. Not to mention how poorly the room were cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: seelster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for only 1 night while we explored the wine country. I booked the room on Priceline and got a great price. It's a very nice place. It has a nice little kitchen in the room that would be nice if we had stayed longer. The bathroom was beautiful and there was a nice patio. Parking was easy and free! I was a little scared about it being located in an office park, but that wasn't a problem at all. It is actually a great location. It was a nice little 10 min drive to get downtown for dinner. We are already talking about coming back to the wine country soon and we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “New, nice and great spa nearby.”
Reviews.Author: mbuns
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night as a girlfriend get away. The room was new and just what we wanted, two very comfy beds, nice built in with frig, sink, micro, toaster oven and all utensils. Bathroom was very nice, again pretty sink area and oversize tub. Small seating area with cafe table plus a flat screen TV with premium channels. Balcony had nice chairs and overlooked The Meritage Resort. Check in was at Meritage which has very nice decor and pleasant staff. We used the Meritage pool area which was very nice, clean, plenty of towels. The two hotels are on the same property and you can move easily between them. Only reason I would not give a 5 star rating is the food. We had room service breakfast which was okay as was the pool side cobb salads. Nothing to write home about. We had facials and messages at the Spa Terra and it was beautiful!!!!! Very nice facilities,staff and all in a cave setting! Very fun.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy”
Reviews.Author: kost44
Reviews.Content: First off, I would never have picked this place under normal circumstances b/c it is so expensive. However, we booked this the night before we got there on priceline. We ended up getting it for $85 before taxes and their "resort fee". The resort fee covers the cost of the bottle of wine they put in the room, soda, and water. We were only there 1 night but helped ourselves to all the water, soda, and wine, so it seemed fair for the 20 dollars. The room was very nice. How we got this one for $85 surprised me, but hey - we took it! This wasn't a suite, but it also wasn't a standard room. It had a nice deep tub, mini fridge, microwave, sink, toaster oven, balcony, washer, dryer, and VERY comfortable king bed. They also had a dvd library which we took advantage of. The decor was traditional tuscanny style and was very tasteful. The concierge was very helpful, as was the front desk. The concierge showed us stuff to do and gave us some great info/savings brochures. The grounds were nice. I took advantage of the 24 hour work out room. The pools were heated and there were bbq's outside of each building. Our room had dishes and utensils, so it seems like a great stay for a family in one of the jr. suites or suites. I would recommend using the BBQ if staying for a while just to save some money. The restaurant was expensive but not THAT bad (we were at a resort, afterall). It was our first time trying Kobe Beef - and it was DELICIOUS!! I think we paid $28 for the steak (that was a la carte - no side dishes) The pizza was enough for 2 people and only cost 12 bucks. I'm used to spending 60 bucks at a holiday inn and getting the usual crap bed and cardboard towels. To stay here for $120 after all was said and done was amazing! I probably wouldn't recommend this place if you were to book at full rate, (just cause I'm cheap) but if you get this place discounted, it's totally worth it. It was a nice little splurge for my husband and I. The vineyard around the hotel is nice, and you definitely feel safe. I think we had to use our room key 3 times before actually getting to our room door. The only complaint I have is the bartender at The Cave. It is the little bar where you can go wine tasting. She ignored us from the get go. I'm not sure if she could tell we didn't belong there or what, but she only came by to give us our wine and our check. She was more than happy to converse with the other patrons - about the beach, directions, night life, wine, friends, clothes, etc...but with us, it was like we were lepers. That didn't make us enjoy our wine tasting experience very much. (b/c while she was yapping, our glasses were empty). I'm sure at least the others liked their experience better ;) The location is definitely not as nice as some, it is smack in the middle of a business complex, but the amenities on the property more than made up for the location. If I could get this room for the same price again, I would probably stay here next time. But if I could get a quaint B&B for the same price I would probably do that instead, just because I think it would ft the whole Napa Valley Feel that I was looking for a little better. And I would take their wine tasting tour instead of vising their bartender in the Cave. I think the tour included 4 wineries, with the shuttle from the resort and back again for an all day outing about $75. Maybe next time!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Choice, Not a Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: ww_kayaker
Reviews.Content: We booked a weekend stay at this Resort as it was labled a "4-Star Resort" and we were able to get a very attractive rate (for a 4-Star Resort) through Hotwire. We were aware of the additional approx. $20 resort fee as well. The Vino Bello Resort is a nice place to stay, but I would certainly not call it 4-Star. Our room: On the plus side, it did have a refirgerator; wet bar; and included bottled water, soda, and a bottle of wine. On the negative side, it was pretty narrow and not that big, the heating system was VERY loud (when it turned on it would wake us up). Further, the walls are VERY thin, as we were woken up by a neighbor's TV early one morning, and could hear a late-night conversation of another neighbor. Also, the Vino Bello rooms are an outside walk away from the main Meritage Resort area (which presumably are more expensive). Amenities: We did not find the Concierge or front-desk very helpful (even for some simple direction advice). The attached restaurant has a very good breakfast. The workout facilities were OK and the wine-tasting appetiers are really just cheese and crackers. There was also a billing mix-up that has yet to be resolved -- but I don't know it that is the hotel's fault or hotwire's fault. Location: The resort is located in a corporate/industrial area, not very close to any vinyards. So the views aren't that wonderful; however, you can get to the Silverado Trail and Napa proper pretty easily (much quicker than if your staying in Carneros or Sonoma). Overall, we probably wouldn't stay here again. They claim it's a 4-star. The price we paid was about what you'd pay for a 3-star (or 3.5). And we felt it was actually a 3-star (or 2.5). It was an OK experience, but not up to the quality that they appear to represent.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Would never return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhtravel4
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a special birthday celebration and we could not have been more disappointed! With the hotel being newer and the previous reviews generally favorable, we took the chance and booked this hotel for the weekend. This hotel tops our list of hotels to NEVER return to again. We went to our room and could not get the heat to kick on. The blower was working full speed and there was practically a gale through the space. We called for maintenance help and they didn't show (forgot us) and then finally came on the third call and were not able to fix the problem. We were so cold while we were waiting we thought we would brew some coffee to warm up and found the machine filthy along with two cups that had already been used by prior guests. The room in general was not very clean and maintenance had obviously been overlooked for a long time. At this point we were moved to a second room and I can tell you that this one was not much better, but at least had some heat which is a good thing in December. I would not recommend this place to anyone. There are many other choices in Napa that would be the same price and in much better condition.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Suite”
Reviews.Author: Buno
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Vino Bello on the advice of a colleague, who was organizing a function in Napa. We got a special rate for a junior suite for about $140, before tax. The rooms were huge, and very nicely furnished. The living room had a nice TV, sofa, gas fireplace, and a good-sized kitchen. The bedroom had very comfortable linens/pillows, and a nice jacuzzi in the bedroom itself. The bathroom was spacious, although we didn't care for the toiletries provided. The location of the hotel is in a corporate park south of town. While the vineyards nearby have only recently been planted, they should grow into a nice scene in 4-5 years or so. The architecture of the hotel itself is nice, with columns, big wood fireplace in the lobby, and nice Christmas decorations. The hotel does have a complimentary shuttle to take you into town. There is a mandatory resort fee which pretty much covers the 'free' bottle of wine and 'free' shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “great place if you don't mind a drive”
Reviews.Author: lea99
Reviews.Content: Being from San Francisco, we have been to a lot of hotels and inns in the napa valley area and I definitely have my favorites. Some friends booked the Vino Bello resort online and we were planning on staying with them. I was at first skeptical due to the fact that I had never heard of it but they said it was a 4 star hotel so I thought we were safe. I will say that the location stinks....it is not in a quaint, charming or picturesque part of the valley and is a 15 minute drive to yountville and surrounded by a corporate business park. However, if you do not mind that or the short drive and you want a really nice room complete with full kitchen, dining area, patio, separate bedroom, bathroom with huge shower and jacuzzi tub, this place is great. The facilities are all incredibly clean and almost feel polished. The people were all friendly and any requests were met on time. This is a great place to spend the day at the wineries and maybe have a nice lunch out and then return with your bottles of wine and have a relaxing evening eating and/or even cooking a great meal. The gas fireplace provided a ton of heat and would be wonderful in the winter. Again, this is not; the ideal location in the valley like the Harvest Inn, but for the money, it is a nice alternative for a luxurious stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you can't stay at Carneros Inn, this is a great alternative”
Reviews.Author: Julzieluv
Reviews.Content: We loved the place. It was as if we lived there. I would purchase one of these as a second home but not a timeshare. The room was perfect and brand new. It had all the accessories from home and I was kind of surprised of the quality. It wasn't cheap. Wine glasses were very nice, the towels were thick and soft, and there was even soap for washing clothes. It was home and at night, we went to the bar at the meritage. I am so hard to please and I normally stay at Carneros Inn but at 800 a night, I felt it was the best deal to stay here for only 239 a night. Great value, clean, fresh, and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: JOD1501
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few night's at this hotel and we had a suite, which is typical "timeshare" accommodation - very comfortable and above average size with all amenities within the suite. The hotel is about a 10 min drive from downtown Napa and is surrounded by an industrial estate, but if you don't mind that, then I would definitely recommend it. The buffet breakfasts are nothing out of this world, but are the usual buffet breakfast offerings in America - plentiful and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Napa/San Fran Anniversary trip included Vino Bello and we're glad it did!”
Reviews.Author: Larry-Pattie
Reviews.Content: These gorgeous condos/timeshares are part of the Meritage Hotel & are an exceptional value if you want more than a hotel room. Perfect if you are exploring Napa and surrounding area because after a long day of wine tasting, its nice to relax in a beautifully appointed, fully equiped new 'apartment suite. If youre like us, it was nice to relax in an 'at home' setting - fireplace, balcony, gorgeous kitchen -after a wonderful day @ the wineries. The 24 hr room service was prompt and very good. Spa was gorgeous (and expensive). Some reviewers mention highway proximity as an issue but we found it convenient (this property in a 'corporate park' but still very nice. Therefore, higher level floors and pool view might be best.) Check your room folder for specials that are not apparent. For example, we later discovered we could have added services to our massages for no charge but did not know (nor were told). DVDs & CDs are available @ the front desk but we only learned that from these reviews, not the hotel. The drawback here (altho experienced travelers will navigate these issues) is that the staff is woefully undertrained or seems in some instances, simply untrained in hospitality. Nice and willing, but totally clueless. This was generally the case and most especially at the valet stand where the young man greated us with 'huh?' when we pulled up and asked whether we should park or leave the car w/him. Maybe it was because he was chewing his lunch loudly. He never asked if we were with the hotel or condo and consequently, we removed our own luggage - he took the car. We needed to retrieve the car which could not be located (10 minutes later), redeposit our luggage and drive back over to the condo section. A bit annoying after a long,east coast flight and drive up from San Fran. On the way up, we stopped for lunch @ Horizons in Sausilito (wonderful) and then a little detour thru Muir Woods - nice to see but not much there if youre not awed by nature. (Trees are over 1000 years old!). As for Napa, do stop for breakfast @ Sarafornia on Lincoln Ave in Calistoga for excellent, home made inexpensive fare. We were unimpressed by Rutherford Grille for lunch/dinner tho everyone seems to recommend it - expensive, very limited wine list and smelled like kenny rogers roasters restaurant. St. Helena Olive Oil Company was a treat to break up the wine tastings (altho the pesto we purchased was confiscated @ the airport because we did not pack it in our checked luggage.) You can taste everything in the store thats for sale. There are hundreds of wineries and you should sample several but we found the 'touristy' ones just fine for first time visitors. (check out many wine country internet coupon specials for wine tastings, etc.) We especially liked Sterling (for the tram ride) and Mondavi (for the tour and grounds) and our favorite was Domaine Carneros where on a lovely terrace - my husband sipped pinot noirs while i tasted the sparkling wines. Don Giovanis (napa?) looked very good for dinner but after a second long winery day - we were again just as happy to have room service instead and watch a movie on one of the two flat screens in the condo. We left on the third day back to San Fran. Check out both Franciscan's on the wharf which even tho in the center of touristville- was excellent for crab and had great decor/views...and Vincentos (on Taylor?) in financial district for dinner. We also had a great time on Adventure Cats sunset bay sail. Great crew! Ecclectic, culturally mixed crowd of passengers made a fun/interesting 1.5 hrs. w/beautiful photo ops. Lunch @ Left at Albequerqe on Union in Pacific Heights was a wonderful surprise find - outstanding, inexpensive fresh food w/cafe seating. Note to non-Californians - signage is awful - we got 'lost' several times - especially around Napa, but it was always either a pretty coast road or winding mountain road so not a totally bad thing!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: bdvorachek
Reviews.Content: We are just finishing our stay at the Vino Bello resort. It was perfect for our all girl Napa Trip. We took a day trip to San Fransisco which was an easy 1 hour drive in. We spent two days touring wineries. You could easily spend a week doing that alone. We highly recommed the wine at the Van Hey Den winery. The resort was absolutely beautiful with a fully stocked kitchen, flat screen tvs and a view of the pool. The pool was heated and warm for those chilly nights. We were thrilled with our stay and could easily recommed this place again. I plan on traveling back again and will try to book another condo here. Thanks for the memories.

Reviews.Title: “don't do it, unless you're interested in a time-share.”
Reviews.Author: SteevOTopanga_CA
Reviews.Content: Well, where to start? I guess with my arrival, to find that this "resort" was in an office park was my first surprise. Second, the lobby was under construction, there was plastic hanging from the ceiling, saw buzzing, hammers banging. Third, the front desk staff seemed well dressed, but unskilled. She didn't know where in the complex my room was, (or she was embarrassed of the room she had assigned.) Next, after being shoved off from the front desk to the "concierge," to get a local area map when the "concierge" lady finally stopped talking to her friend or co-worker, she immediately when into her routine of trying to bribe me into submitting to a sales pitch to buy into the time-share. After telling her I was only there for a couple of days and didn't care to spend my vacation time listening to a sales pitch, I was treated rudely. I had to get her attention again to ask for a local map, and was told to look in the local magazine. Fifth, upon entering my room it was small but well appointed. I opened the curtains on the patio to see the back of the time-share sales office. Temporary office trailers, with big loud air conditioning units, what a view! Of course I called the front desk to see if they had a better room available, luckily they did, no offers to have a bellman move us, just a come switch out your keys (the office is at least a football field away from the condos.) Our new room had a view of the pool, which was better, but when sitting on our patio we got to hear the sales pitch over and over again, as the sales team herded prospective buyers through the complex. Our next experience with Vino Bello is one of an overall design flaw, noise. The paths and walkways around the complex are concrete, and brick. Since the Vino Bello are not in close proximity with the restaurant, and other utilities used to service there guests, the staff has to push hard wheeled carts around on these paths, " KA-CLUNCK....KA-CLUNCK....KA-CLUNCK, dat,dat,dat,dat,dat,dat,dat,KA-CLUNCK....KA-CLUNK. You get the picture right. These noises started around 7 am, right when you feel like getting up, after wine tasting the day before. Overall, I would not stay here again. Mainly, because of the time-share deal, and the ignorance of the designer's choices in either the materials used to make the pathways or the choice of having the staff use the same walkways as patrons to service the rooms. These are two factors that will be hard to overcome, and make this establishment a far cry from a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: sarahkaye23
Reviews.Content: The resort is split into two properties that share staff - Vino Bello, which are condos intended for sale that are rented out, and the Meritage, which is a traditional hotel, so you may want to check out the reviews on both properties. The concierge was a mess - confused, hurried, and generally not helpful. The desk staff forgot to call us when our room was ready as requested. Otherwise, all the service was acceptable - we made a number of calls from our room to request corkscrews, towels, movies (they have a DVD library), and room service, and all requests were met promptly. Our room was really spectacular - we had a 1 bedroom king suite, for which we paid about $250 for a Thursday night (a steal for this room, which was beautifully appointed and was pushing at least 1000 sq. ft.) and $350 for Friday night. They're also in the process on planting vineyards on all sides of the property, which eliminates the "office park" feel. The restaurant was better than average, the pool area is really nice, and the spa and tasting room looked great, although we never made it over there during their operating hours (it closes at 6-7 pm). The location is good enough for highway access to wineries etc. I would definitely stay here again during the week - you get a lot more room for your money than at other properties.

Reviews.Title: “Good but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: kcooper229
Reviews.Content: Bottom line - I thought the Vino Bello was a good value and a beautiful property. The amenities were very nice and the location was convenient. The spa was outstanding. The restaurant and food was great. That said, there were some issues I would not have expected from a resort of this apparent caliber. Most of the complaints are minor (noisy A/C, weird design with "echo-chamber" - like entry), but I guess I was most disappointed with the front desk staff who did not seem to be at all concerned with customer satisfaction. Our key cards stopped working at one point (as did the couple we were traveling with), and although the desk staff fixed them and explained that they tend to become demagnatized (or something), he was not very courteous about it. Desk staff also seemed unconcerned when I reported that the washing machine was apparently in need of service as it seemed like there were loose parts, resulting in sounding like a jackhammer. Furthermore, the couple traveling with us had reserved a one bedroom and were given a studio. When they addressed this with the desk staff, they were rude and dismissive and said they would need to take it up with Hotels.com. All of these are things that happen, but a simple, "I'm so sorry for the inconvenience - let me see what I can do..." goes a long way in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Wine, sun, wine and wine in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: Carlito106ohYeah
Reviews.Content: Whats up. So me and the lovely wife went to the Vino Bello (Meritage) Resort in Napa Valley this June for 5 days for our 2 year anniv. Had a super great time. First off..The Resort: The Good-Rooms are really big (all with balconies, some with bedroom hot tubs...not mine. Also, I recomend requesting a room with a pool view, not parking lot view..like mine), LCD TVs, 2 nice pools with heated jacuzzis, great Cave wine Bar/Spa (built into the ground, under newly planted grape fields), good price, within 5 miles of downtown Napa. The Bad-The doors close loudly, service aint that great, and its in a corporate park 10-15 miles from the main strip of vineyards (in fact, you really should rent a car for this trip). We did the hot air ballon thing with napa valley ballons...was fn terrific! (ran over a rabbit on the way...ugh, it still haunts me...I mean, it wasnt even dawn yet, it was still way dark, I tried to swerve, he had no chance). The napa valley train was not worth it...too expensive, too slow, boring (rent a car, drive to a bunch of vineyards and get private tastings, and you will have a much better time). Go to the tastings during the week if at all possible (to avoid crazy SF weekend crowds) and talk to the wine pourer...they know a lot of sh*t, love to talk about wine and can point out their favorite vineyards...being wine novices, we learned a lot, quickly. If you don't know what tannen is before napa you will after. A few places we especially dug: Mondavi, Fransiscan, Arrowhead, Chandon (champagne). Hope the pics came out ok. Have a great day!! Thanks for reading. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Awful customer service, rooms ok”
Reviews.Author: sy123
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write scathing reviews concerning hotel stays, but when your stay is worse than your overall impression based on price and location, there's reason for complaint. Bad experiences: - unfriendly, unconcerned attitude from front desk people (probably due to a lack of training on the part of the management, but common sense would be to make the customer believe you are actually interested in helping them instead of being indifferent). No professionalism, whatsover. - no offer for compensation after we complained about not being able to sleep the first night with the air conditioning not being able to turn off. The front desk responded that there was no way to help us since the service personnel was not available at the time. The front desk did not make a note of the problem so it could be fixed, instead we had to complain the next day. - a lack of communication between front desk and service personnel. (Having to visit the front desk twice, at 10 am and 5 pm to check on service to a malfunctioning air conditioning system that wasn't even begun until we requested the manager at 5 pm to take care of this, is unacceptable for a hotel). Their response was to shut off the air conditioning unit completely without letting us know what was happening. Is the customer supposed to perform investigations to find out what's going? I don't think so. The hotel should be notifying any guest about updates when something is wrong with their room. The next night the room was stuffy, and we had to sleep with the sliding door cracked open. This place seems to not care about investing in good training for any of the people who work here ( I can not speak for the restaurant or bar since I didn't experience them). They give the impression that they are only concerned in selling their time share condos. It would serve them well to change this impression if they want any repeat stays from anyone. I would never suggest this place to any of my friends or family. it's best to stay somewhere else that has a better location (not near a highway, power lines, and a satellite station, their website photos are misleading), better customer service, and better price/value.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay!”
Reviews.Author: tjibbs
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a single bedroom (middle size of their three room options) for five nights. Visiting family in Napa, so some of the other criticisms about the distance from Wine Country were a bit moot. That said, people, consult an invention known as a 'Map.' Should be clear that you're not on Mondavi, Beringer, Sattui's doorstep from this place. But you are in a very close distance to Artessa, Domaine, etc. Had a 3rd floor. Only noise issue was the jacuzzi below us, which they ran at 11 PM, and it DID sound like it was in the room with us. Other negatives: a lot of little stuff breaks (t.p. holder; detergent cover on washer; etc.). They struggle with little details (i.e., our key, too, stopped working on day three; we also were not checked in on time, and they tried to book us on the 1st floor, at that; had to call to request USA Today). Never tried the restaurant, but little need to given the great kitchen and adequate dining options in Napa. Very roomy, spacious; great balcony; very low-pressure time-share push; pool was terrific and always sparsely populated; easy highway access; clean; staff I dealt with was super. And at $206/night, well worth it--I'll stay here again assuming it isn't bought out.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are dead-on”
Reviews.Author: Trapuh
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews before booking my stay and although I was concerned about some of the complaints I felt that the rate I found (under $200/night for a "studio") was too good to pass up. While I found many of the complaints to be valid I do not feel that they are egregious enough to prevent me from giving this resort a positive review. I will address each of the complaints individually. 1. The resort is in an office park. This is true, however, one would not know you were in an office park while on the premises. While on resort grounds you cannot see any office buildings nor experience any office traffic; you only know you're in an office park by using one of the two street entrances to the resort. I stayed Monday through Friday and did not have any office park experience while there. 2. The resort is close to a highway. This also is true; the resort is nestled in the "crotch" of two main roads. However, while you can see the road from the parking lot you are not close enough to hear any traffic from the roads or let the existence of the road detract from the otherwise fine view of the fields. 3. The room keys stop working. Absolutely. On the third day our key cards mysteriously stopped working. Although I was on the lookout for this potential problem I neglected to tell my girlfriend who was greatly inconvenienced. She was carrying packages to our room (while I was stumbling around the wine cave) and she had to go to the main hotel building (The Meritage) in order to get new keys made. A bellhop blamed the inexperience of the front desk staff but I think there is a greater problem here since this is a complaint many of the reviewers had. 4. You can hear doors slamming. Dead on. This is perhaps the biggest complaint I have about this resort. While we did not hear noises from other rooms (voices, tv, sounds of intimacy, etc.) we constantly heard doors closing. This was very irritating - especially at night. 5. Inexperienced staff. I am unsure about this one. Although one staff member said it about other staff members (as I discussed above) I cannot definitively state that the staff is inexperienced. The only example of incompetence (not necessarily inexperience) was that after we ordered room service (one sandwich) they forgot we ever ordered it. When we called to see where the sandwich was they confessed and then delivered the sandwich promptly - and gratis. 6. Dearth of close parking. This is also true. One night we had to park on the other end of the resort as all of the spots immediately adjacent to the resort buildings were taken. As we are relatively young and healthy this did not pose much of a problem for us; just an inconvenience. 7. The resort is far from the city center and wineries. This is true. However, it's not like you walk from one attraction to another in Napa - you have to drive . Since you're driving anyway, an extra 3-5 minutes in the car won't kill you. 8. The concierge will try to sell you a timeshare. True. After speaking with the concierge for 10 minutes she invited us to a Shell Vacations pitch meeting with the enticement of coupons, etc. However, a quick "no, thank you" ended her endeavor. Interestingly, while at a SF Giants game a table of gentlemen from Shell Vacations offered us similar enticements - and even added a few free nights at the Vino Bello - if I were to go to their pitch. I'll add a few last complaints before I address the virtues. The housekeeping staff is overly eager. The housekeepers try to access the room starting at 9AM and then keep coming back every 20-30 minutes either knocking first or just trying to enter with their keys. After this happened the first morning we made sure to hang the "do not disturb" sign on the door until we left the room in the morning. However, one morning when we decided to sleep in very late (it happens when you do many wine tastings the day before without availing yourself of the spit bucket) the sign did not dissuade the staff who repeatedly knocked on our door from early morning until we left in the early afternoon. The housekeepers lost out on a nice tip because of this. One last complaint is about checkout time. The reservation I made stated that checkout time was noon. The hotel literature in the room stated it was noon. A sign in the room said it was 11AM. On the morning of checkout I was told by the front desk that it was 11AM; although they graciously gave me a "late" checkout at 11:45AM. Reminding them that their own literature gave the time at noon did not give me that extra 15 minutes. Since I am a rebel I checked out at 11:50. Now on to the good points. The rooms are very nice - nice bed and pillows, large bathroom, tub/shower easily accommodated my 6'3" frame, washer/dryer in every room and the rooms are just nicely appointed. Although I was hoping to get a free upgrade to a one bedroom suite (as did another reviewer) an Acura management outing that took up a large part of the resort seemed to put the kibosh on my hopes of getting a bigger room. The studio was fine - not huge but big enough - but it irked me that we were missing out on a jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. Oh well. When you check in there are free bottles of water, cans of soda and a bottle of white wine in the refrigerator. It was not until the last day that I realized that they replace the water and soda on a daily basis - I was stupidly buying my own bottled water and soft drinks when I could have had them for free all along. I am unsure if they replace the bottle of wine because I never drank it; but I doubt they do. The outdoor pool and hot tub are fine. The spa is just as expensive as any other hotel - so I didn't try it. The wine cave was nothing more than a bar - nothing fascinating there. The bartender was nice and told me that they expect the vines on the premises to start being productive in a few years. Meanwhile they serve wine from their house brand whose grapes come from other parts of California. Overall, my experience at the Vino Bello resort was fine. It is not a resort that is a destination in and of itself but it is a perfectly nice place to lay your head and go for a quick dip when on a trip visiting wineries. If you can book this place in the area of $200/night you should not pass it up. I predict that in the future it will command much more per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bad restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ZorglubWaterloo
Reviews.Content: The resort is excellent. Very nice buildings, rooms are brand new and with very nice decoration, including bathroom. We have a studio, it was very big. Swimming pool is excellent, especially for kids, they have some nice games there. Location is not that bad as many reviews say. OK it is behind the highway, but not that close, we were not disturbed by any noise or proximity. The black point is the restaurant, we had 3 breakfasts there, you need to wait for 30 minutes to get 2 pieces of toast and milk for our boy. We complained about that, but nothing from the staff excepted some excuse. I even asked if we had to go to the grocery store to buy the milk for my son's cereals after waiting 20 minutes. Overall, I highly recommand to go sleep there, but bring your own breakfast and food!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Condo, So-So Food”
Reviews.Author: luckylyn555
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from spending 5 nights at Vino Bello in Napa for our 1st annversary. Vino Bello is part of a timeshare plan, but they also rent the condos (studios, one-bedrooms, and two-bedrooms) on a nightly busy (which is what we did). Good Points: The condo itself. We stayed in a one-bedroom condo on the second floor. Very nice, spacious, new place. Full-sized kitchen with granite countertops, stainless appliances, dishes/glasses/pans, etc. Large bath with granite countertop, double sinks, large walk-in shower with tumbled marble/stone tile work on two walls and floor, seamless glass on remaining two walls, 5 showerheads (one large rain head and four pulsating bodysprays). Jacuzzi bath tub in stone surround in bedroom (actually in kind of a dressing alcove in bedroom, between room and bathroom). 37" flat screen TV in living room and 26" flatscreen TV in bedroom. Large balcony with table and 4 chairs, plus small settee (we lucked out and got a second floor room overlooking the balcony - recommend 2nd floor over 3rd floor as 3rd floor balconies don't have a roof, and the sun can get pretty hot! Bad Points: As mentioned in other reviews, service is definitely a problem. Checked in at 2:30 pm (check in time is 4:00 pm), told room would be expedited and we would be called on cell phone - finally went back to desk at 5:15 pm as never got a call. Turns out room had been ready since 3 pm but the lone front desk agent was too busy to call. Food at Siena was just OK for lunch but highly disappointing for dinner. Because we travelled on our anniversary, I decided that we would be too tired to leave the resort for dinner. Since the dinner menu at Sienna looked good on the website, I booked a table through Open Table, indicating it was our first wedding anniversary. When we arrived at Siena for dinner, it was practically deserted. There was no acknowledgement of our anniversary (no congratulations, offer of dessert or whatever). We were disappointed to find that, rather than the menu posted on the resort's website, we were given the same menu as we were given earlier that day for lunch (while waiting for the room to be ready). My husband's food was just OK while my rotisserie chicken was terrible - very dry - and the tiramisu was also not good. We didn't go back at all the rest of the stay. On third day, key cards didn't work - had to walk to front desk for new ones. On fourth day, I got locked out of room after going to the vending machine (again, key card didn't work) and there was no way to reach my husband (each set of two rooms has a little foyer with a locked foyer door to the hall - no doorbell from hall and no way for my husband to hear me knocking on the foyer door). I wandered throughout the building looking for a house phone to call my husband, but there aren't any. Just as I was about to give up and walk back to the front desk (in another building across the parking lot, at the Meritage Hotel), I tried knocking at the foyer door and luckily my husband had just stepped into the foyer in preparation for looking for me - I had been gone about 20 minutes on what should have been a 5 minute vending machine visit. All in all, I would definitely stay there again - the condo was lovely (though perhaps they overdid the wine decor slightly) and spacious, and the rates were extremely reasonable for Napa. However, I would not eat in Siena again, and we will be checking our key cards constantly to make sure they are continuing to work!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Lacks knowledge in Service”
Reviews.Author: Bevis1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a a 4 day stay. Resort is so beautiful, great location. Awsome spa. Cleaning staff does an excellent job. Room service prompt and the food was good. Front desk staff was nice and trys but are undertrained and young. Top Management needs to spend some overtime helping out and training the staff in the basics. I am an corporate event planner and observed actions or lack of that bring this resort short of being really good. Simple basics being overlooked.. Rooms keys constantly not working due to people not keeping card keys away from cell phones however front desk could help alleviate this problem by warning people at check in. I highly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service in Napa”
Reviews.Author: UsuallyHappyChicago
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not bad, but forget about having any good service. After checking in at noon with our 2 yr old, we were told the room was not ready and they would expedite the room and call me on my cell. At 4:05 I checked back with the front desk and was told the room was ready. They told me to go to the wrong building and when we finally found the room the keys did not work. The concierge could see me through the glass door but was not willing to get off her chair to let me in the building. We asked to speak with the general manager (Steve Arnold) and was told he was on his was to my room. After an hour I called back to speak with the general manager and was told by the acting manager (Robert Wichter) that he was not on-site and nobody knew when to expect him. I will never stay at this hotel again. Unless you want to be pissed off, don't stay here either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sourgreengrapes
Reviews.Content: I did a ton of research on hotels before booking Vino for my Napa trip 7 months ago. I got an incredible deal on the room. If you don't mind the location, you won't be diappointed. Rooms were very clean, spacious, and well decorated. Love it. If we are in Napa again, we would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully decorated and loaded with amenities”
Reviews.Author: kkushiba1
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous reviews, I can understand how staying on the 1st floor might have meant undergoing the noisy slamming of the main door to at least building 1 of the complex not to mention the sounds of cars parking and construction workers sawing near the Siena restaurant. Miraculously, we were assigned the extremely quiet room #1310 at the very end of building 1 on the top floor (well, 3rd floor) facing the pool and we completely enjoyed our stay. As some of the reviews have mentioned, the decor was well done (draping fanning-canopy-like structure over the bed's headboard, coordinated furniture) and the amenities so over-the-top outstanding that one might marvel at how much luxury and comfort can be stuffed into one space. We had a lovely kitchen complete with a dishwasher/microwave/range/refrigerator/cabinets filled with dishes/etc, a washer and dryer, a bathroom the size of a small bedroom, stacks of plush towels, cotton terry bathrobes, a huge oval tub with jet jacuzzi spray action, two flat screen tv's, so many comfortable lushly decorated chairs, a couch with a pull-out bed, extra sheets and pillows, chairs for the bar, a dining room table with chairs, a balcony with patio furniture, a safe for our valuables, and wifi. I was shocked at how clean everything was (no stains(water on wood or rust) or grout problems in the bathroom and kitchen areas) and I actually found the maids and the other workers cordial and rather kind, including one young man carrying a room service tray seemed nice. I do think that some of the staff are very young and perhaps new to the service industry. We liked the pool area and were delighted by how colorfully creative the sprinkler play area was for kids. We used 2 (1ft deep one and the standard one) of the 3 pools in the area and loved the convenience of the clean towels, the abundance of impeccable pretty chaise-lounge chairs and other patio furniture. To reach the pool area, one must pass through either the male or female dressing rooms, both (I'm guessing as I passed through just one) equipped with bathrooms and a shower area. We had problems with 2 of the 3 keys we received for our room. I chatted with someone else on our floor who said that he had 3 bad ones. Also, the wifi didn't work too well and we had to fiddle with our wireless card drivers on our laptops. I did see an RJ45 ethernet socket so perhaps one might use it as a last resort. Local calls and 800 number ones seemed to be free. The Siena restaurant was undergoing some renovations, so they moved it to one of the bigger banquet rooms. Breakfast was buffet-style with ample choices including some interesting choices such as brie cheese, lox, and tiny round pickles attached to pieces of their vine. However, you need to ask the waiter for toast choices, including bagels. In the evenings, they light up the fireplace in the lobby of the also well-decorated main building which is rather nice. There's a spa and a wine cave located near the pool area of the main building too. The resort, the neighboring business park, and the vineyards are all rather new and perhaps far from downtown Napa. So at least at the resort, it'll take some years when there'll be more shaded outdoor areas to sit and other vegetation . The resort offers a shuttle with free service to any location 5 miles or less. There's an Italian restaurant called Villa Romano nearby which serves pretty food. The dryer was noisy and moreover very weak. The way around the problem was to do our laundry during non-sleeping hours and to leave the dryer running for over an hour. I too thought that some of the toiletries like the shampoo and lotion were rather simple as opposed to those offered at for example, the Sonoma Mission Inn. However, we certainly enjoyed our stay despite whatever shortcomings we encountered.
